   81: distribution, or communication of the Original Work or Derivative Works in any

  198: GNU AFFERO GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE
  199:                        Version 3, 19 November 2007
  200: 
  201:  Copyright (C) 2007 Free Software Foundation, Inc. <https://fsf.org/>
  202:  Everyone is permitted to copy and distribute verbatim copies
  203:  of this license document, but changing it is not allowed.
  204: 
  205:                             Preamble
  206: 
  207:   The GNU Affero General Public License is a free, copyleft license for
  208: software and other kinds of works, specifically designed to ensure
  209: cooperation with the community in the case of network server software.
  210: 
  211:   The licenses for most software and other practical works are designed
  212: to take away your freedom to share and change the works.  By contrast,
  213: our General Public Licenses are intended to guarantee your freedom to
  214: share and change all versions of a program--to make sure it remains free
  215: software for all its users.
  216: 
  217:   When we speak of free software, we are referring to freedom, not
  218: price.  Our General Public Licenses are designed to make sure that you
  219: have the freedom to distribute copies of free software (and charge for
  220: them if you wish), that you receive source code or can get it if you
  221: want it, that you can change the software or use pieces of it in new
  222: free programs, and that you know you can do these things.
  223: 
  224:   Developers that use our General Public Licenses protect your rights
  225: with two steps: (1) assert copyright on the software, and (2) offer
  226: you this License which gives you legal permission to copy, distribute
  227: and/or modify the software.
  228: 
  229:   A secondary benefit of defending all users' freedom is that
  230: improvements made in alternate versions of the program, if they
  231: receive widespread use, become available for other developers to
  232: incorporate.  Many developers of free software are heartened and
  233: encouraged by the resulting cooperation.  However, in the case of
  234: software used on network servers, this result may fail to come about.
  235: The GNU General Public License permits making a modified version and
  236: letting the public access it on a server without ever releasing its
  237: source code to the public.
  238: 
  239:   The GNU Affero General Public License is designed specifically to
  240: ensure that, in such cases, the modified source code becomes available
  241: to the community.  It requires the operator of a network server to
  242: provide the source code of the modified version running there to the
  243: users of that server.  Therefore, public use of a modified version, on
  244: a publicly accessible server, gives the public access to the source
  245: code of the modified version.
  246: 
  247:   An older license, called the Affero General Public License and
  248: published by Affero, was designed to accomplish similar goals.  This is
  249: a different license, not a version of the Affero GPL, but Affero has
  250: released a new version of the Affero GPL which permits relicensing under
  251: this license.
  252: 
  253:   The precise terms and conditions for copying, distribution and
  254: modification follow.
  255: 
  256:                        TERMS AND CONDITIONS
  257: 
  258:   0. Definitions.
  259: 
  260:   "This License" refers to version 3 of the GNU Affero General Public License.
  261: 
  262:   "Copyright" also means copyright-like laws that apply to other kinds of
  263: works, such as semiconductor masks.
  264: 
  265:   "The Program" refers to any copyrightable work licensed under this
  266: License.  Each licensee is addressed as "you".  "Licensees" and
  267: "recipients" may be individuals or organizations.
  268: 
  269:   To "modify" a work means to copy from or adapt all or part of the work
  270: in a fashion requiring copyright permission, other than the making of an
  271: exact copy.  The resulting work is called a "modified version" of the
  272: earlier work or a work "based on" the earlier work.
  273: 
  274:   A "covered work" means either the unmodified Program or a work based
  275: on the Program.
  276: 
  277:   To "propagate" a work means to do anything with it that, without
  278: permission, would make you directly or secondarily liable for
  279: infringement under applicable copyright law, except executing it on a
  280: computer or modifying a private copy.  Propagation includes copying,
  281: distribution (with or without modification), making available to the
  282: public, and in some countries other activities as well.
  283: 
  284:   To "convey" a work means any kind of propagation that enables other
  285: parties to make or receive copies.  Mere interaction with a user through
  286: a computer network, with no transfer of a copy, is not conveying.
  287: 
  288:   An interactive user interface displays "Appropriate Legal Notices"
  289: to the extent that it includes a convenient and prominently visible
  290: feature that (1) displays an appropriate copyright notice, and (2)
  291: tells the user that there is no warranty for the work (except to the
  292: extent that warranties are provided), that licensees may convey the
  293: work under this License, and how to view a copy of this License.  If
  294: the interface presents a list of user commands or options, such as a
  295: menu, a prominent item in the list meets this criterion.
  296: 
  297:   1. Source Code.
  298: 
  299:   The "source code" for a work means the preferred form of the work
  300: for making modifications to it.  "Object code" means any non-source
  301: form of a work.
  302: 
  303:   A "Standard Interface" means an interface that either is an official
  304: standard defined by a recognized standards body, or, in the case of
  305: interfaces specified for a particular programming language, one that
  306: is widely used among developers working in that language.
  307: 
  308:   The "System Libraries" of an executable work include anything, other
  309: than the work as a whole, that (a) is included in the normal form of
  310: packaging a Major Component, but which is not part of that Major
  311: Component, and (b) serves only to enable use of the work with that
  312: Major Component, or to implement a Standard Interface for which an
  313: implementation is available to the public in source code form.  A
  314: "Major Component", in this context, means a major essential component
  315: (kernel, window system, and so on) of the specific operating system
  316: (if any) on which the executable work runs, or a compiler used to
  317: produce the work, or an object code interpreter used to run it.
  318: 
  319:   The "Corresponding Source" for a work in object code form means all
  320: the source code needed to generate, install, and (for an executable
  321: work) run the object code and to modify the work, including scripts to
  322: control those activities.  However, it does not include the work's
  323: System Libraries, or general-purpose tools or generally available free
  324: programs which are used unmodified in performing those activities but
  325: which are not part of the work.  For example, Corresponding Source
  326: includes interface definition files associated with source files for
  327: the work, and the source code for shared libraries and dynamically
  328: linked subprograms that the work is specifically designed to require,
  329: such as by intimate data communication or control flow between those
  330: subprograms and other parts of the work.
  331: 
  332:   The Corresponding Source need not include anything that users
  333: can regenerate automatically from other parts of the Corresponding
  334: Source.
  335: 
  336:   The Corresponding Source for a work in source code form is that
  337: same work.
  338: 
  339:   2. Basic Permissions.
  340: 
  341:   All rights granted under this License are granted for the term of
  342: copyright on the Program, and are irrevocable provided the stated
  343: conditions are met.  This License explicitly affirms your unlimited
  344: permission to run the unmodified Program.  The output from running a
  345: covered work is covered by this License only if the output, given its
  346: content, constitutes a covered work.  This License acknowledges your
  347: rights of fair use or other equivalent, as provided by copyright law.
  348: 
  349:   You may make, run and propagate covered works that you do not
  350: convey, without conditions so long as your license otherwise remains
  351: in force.  You may convey covered works to others for the sole purpose
  352: of having them make modifications exclusively for you, or provide you
  353: with facilities for running those works, provided that you comply with
  354: the terms of this License in conveying all material for which you do
  355: not control copyright.  Those thus making or running the covered works
  356: for you must do so exclusively on your behalf, under your direction
  357: and control, on terms that prohibit them from making any copies of
  358: your copyrighted material outside their relationship with you.
  359: 
  360:   Conveying under any other circumstances is permitted solely under
  361: the conditions stated below.  Sublicensing is not allowed; section 10
  362: makes it unnecessary.
  363: 
  364:   3. Protecting Users' Legal Rights From Anti-Circumvention Law.
  365: 
  366:   No covered work shall be deemed part of an effective technological
  367: measure under any applicable law fulfilling obligations under article
  368: 11 of the WIPO copyright treaty adopted on 20 December 1996, or
  369: similar laws prohibiting or restricting circumvention of such
  370: measures.
  371: 
  372:   When you convey a covered work, you waive any legal power to forbid
  373: circumvention of technological measures to the extent such circumvention
  374: is effected by exercising rights under this License with respect to
  375: the covered work, and you disclaim any intention to limit operation or
  376: modification of the work as a means of enforcing, against the work's
  377: users, your or third parties' legal rights to forbid circumvention of
  378: technological measures.
  379: 
  380:   4. Conveying Verbatim Copies.
  381: 
  382:   You may convey verbatim copies of the Program's source code as you
  383: receive it, in any medium, provided that you conspicuously and
  384: appropriately publish on each copy an appropriate copyright notice;
  385: keep intact all notices stating that this License and any
  386: non-permissive terms added in accord with section 7 apply to the code;
  387: keep intact all notices of the absence of any warranty; and give all
  388: recipients a copy of this License along with the Program.
  389: 
  390:   You may charge any price or no price for each copy that you convey,
  391: and you may offer support or warranty protection for a fee.
  392: 
  393:   5. Conveying Modified Source Versions.
  394: 
  395:   You may convey a work based on the Program, or the modifications to
  396: produce it from the Program, in the form of source code under the
  397: terms of section 4, provided that you also meet all of these conditions:
  398: 
  399:     a) The work must carry prominent notices stating that you modified
  400:     it, and giving a relevant date.
  401: 
  402:     b) The work must carry prominent notices stating that it is
  403:     released under this License and any conditions added under section
  404:     7.  This requirement modifies the requirement in section 4 to
  405:     "keep intact all notices".
  406: 
  407:     c) You must license the entire work, as a whole, under this
  408:     License to anyone who comes into possession of a copy.  This
  409:     License will therefore apply, along with any applicable section 7
  410:     additional terms, to the whole of the work, and all its parts,
  411:     regardless of how they are packaged.  This License gives no
  412:     permission to license the work in any other way, but it does not
  413:     invalidate such permission if you have separately received it.
  414: 
  415:     d) If the work has interactive user interfaces, each must display
  416:     Appropriate Legal Notices; however, if the Program has interactive
  417:     interfaces that do not display Appropriate Legal Notices, your
  418:     work need not make them do so.
  419: 
  420:   A compilation of a covered work with other separate and independent
  421: works, which are not by their nature extensions of the covered work,
  422: and which are not combined with it such as to form a larger program,
  423: in or on a volume of a storage or distribution medium, is called an
  424: "aggregate" if the compilation and its resulting copyright are not
  425: used to limit the access or legal rights of the compilation's users
  426: beyond what the individual works permit.  Inclusion of a covered work
  427: in an aggregate does not cause this License to apply to the other
  428: parts of the aggregate.
  429: 
  430:   6. Conveying Non-Source Forms.
  431: 
  432:   You may convey a covered work in object code form under the terms
  433: of sections 4 and 5, provided that you also convey the
  434: machine-readable Corresponding Source under the terms of this License,
  435: in one of these ways:
  436: 
  437:     a) Convey the object code in, or embodied in, a physical product
  438:     (including a physical distribution medium), accompanied by the
  439:     Corresponding Source fixed on a durable physical medium
  440:     customarily used for software interchange.
  441: 
  442:     b) Convey the object code in, or embodied in, a physical product
  443:     (including a physical distribution medium), accompanied by a
  444:     written offer, valid for at least three years and valid for as
  445:     long as you offer spare parts or customer support for that product
  446:     model, to give anyone who possesses the object code either (1) a
  447:     copy of the Corresponding Source for all the software in the
  448:     product that is covered by this License, on a durable physical
  449:     medium customarily used for software interchange, for a price no
  450:     more than your reasonable cost of physically performing this
  451:     conveying of source, or (2) access to copy the
  452:     Corresponding Source from a network server at no charge.
  453: 
  454:     c) Convey individual copies of the object code with a copy of the
  455:     written offer to provide the Corresponding Source.  This
  456:     alternative is allowed only occasionally and noncommercially, and
  457:     only if you received the object code with such an offer, in accord
  458:     with subsection 6b.
  459: 
  460:     d) Convey the object code by offering access from a designated
  461:     place (gratis or for a charge), and offer equivalent access to the
  462:     Corresponding Source in the same way through the same place at no
  463:     further charge.  You need not require recipients to copy the
  464:     Corresponding Source along with the object code.  If the place to
  465:     copy the object code is a network server, the Corresponding Source
  466:     may be on a different server (operated by you or a third party)
  467:     that supports equivalent copying facilities, provided you maintain
  468:     clear directions next to the object code saying where to find the
  469:     Corresponding Source.  Regardless of what server hosts the
  470:     Corresponding Source, you remain obligated to ensure that it is
  471:     available for as long as needed to satisfy these requirements.
  472: 
  473:     e) Convey the object code using peer-to-peer transmission, provided
  474:     you inform other peers where the object code and Corresponding
  475:     Source of the work are being offered to the general public at no
  476:     charge under subsection 6d.
  477: 
  478:   A separable portion of the object code, whose source code is excluded
  479: from the Corresponding Source as a System Library, need not be
  480: included in conveying the object code work.
  481: 
  482:   A "User Product" is either (1) a "consumer product", which means any
  483: tangible personal property which is normally used for personal, family,
  484: or household purposes, or (2) anything designed or sold for incorporation
  485: into a dwelling.  In determining whether a product is a consumer product,
  486: doubtful cases shall be resolved in favor of coverage.  For a particular
  487: product received by a particular user, "normally used" refers to a
  488: typical or common use of that class of product, regardless of the status
  489: of the particular user or of the way in which the particular user
  490: actually uses, or expects or is expected to use, the product.  A product
  491: is a consumer product regardless of whether the product has substantial
  492: commercial, industrial or non-consumer uses, unless such uses represent
  493: the only significant mode of use of the product.
  494: 
  495:   "Installation Information" for a User Product means any methods,
  496: procedures, authorization keys, or other information required to install
  497: and execute modified versions of a covered work in that User Product from
  498: a modified version of its Corresponding Source.  The information must
  499: suffice to ensure that the continued functioning of the modified object
  500: code is in no case prevented or interfered with solely because
  501: modification has been made.
  502: 
  503:   If you convey an object code work under this section in, or with, or
  504: specifically for use in, a User Product, and the conveying occurs as
  505: part of a transaction in which the right of possession and use of the
  506: User Product is transferred to the recipient in perpetuity or for a
  507: fixed term (regardless of how the transaction is characterized), the
  508: Corresponding Source conveyed under this section must be accompanied
  509: by the Installation Information.  But this requirement does not apply
  510: if neither you nor any third party retains the ability to install
  511: modified object code on the User Product (for example, the work has
  512: been installed in ROM).
  513: 
  514:   The requirement to provide Installation Information does not include a
  515: requirement to continue to provide support service, warranty, or updates
  516: for a work that has been modified or installed by the recipient, or for
  517: the User Product in which it has been modified or installed.  Access to a
  518: network may be denied when the modification itself materially and
  519: adversely affects the operation of the network or violates the rules and
  520: protocols for communication across the network.
  521: 
  522:   Corresponding Source conveyed, and Installation Information provided,
  523: in accord with this section must be in a format that is publicly
  524: documented (and with an implementation available to the public in
  525: source code form), and must require no special password or key for
  526: unpacking, reading or copying.
  527: 
  528:   7. Additional Terms.
  529: 
  530:   "Additional permissions" are terms that supplement the terms of this
  531: License by making exceptions from one or more of its conditions.
  532: Additional permissions that are applicable to the entire Program shall
  533: be treated as though they were included in this License, to the extent
  534: that they are valid under applicable law.  If additional permissions
  535: apply only to part of the Program, that part may be used separately
  536: under those permissions, but the entire Program remains governed by
  537: this License without regard to the additional permissions.
  538: 
  539:   When you convey a copy of a covered work, you may at your option
  540: remove any additional permissions from that copy, or from any part of
  541: it.  (Additional permissions may be written to require their own
  542: removal in certain cases when you modify the work.)  You may place
  543: additional permissions on material, added by you to a covered work,
  544: for which you have or can give appropriate copyright permission.
  545: 
  546:   Notwithstanding any other provision of this License, for material you
  547: add to a covered work, you may (if authorized by the copyright holders of
  548: that material) supplement the terms of this License with terms:
  549: 
  550:     a) Disclaiming warranty or limiting liability differently from the
  551:     terms of sections 15 and 16 of this License; or
  552: 
  553:     b) Requiring preservation of specified reasonable legal notices or
  554:     author attributions in that material or in the Appropriate Legal
  555:     Notices displayed by works containing it; or
  556: 
  557:     c) Prohibiting misrepresentation of the origin of that material, or
  558:     requiring that modified versions of such material be marked in
  559:     reasonable ways as different from the original version; or
  560: 
  561:     d) Limiting the use for publicity purposes of names of licensors or
  562:     authors of the material; or
  563: 
  564:     e) Declining to grant rights under trademark law for use of some
  565:     trade names, trademarks, or service marks; or
  566: 
  567:     f) Requiring indemnification of licensors and authors of that
  568:     material by anyone who conveys the material (or modified versions of
  569:     it) with contractual assumptions of liability to the recipient, for
  570:     any liability that these contractual assumptions directly impose on
  571:     those licensors and authors.
  572: 
  573:   All other non-permissive additional terms are considered "further
  574: restrictions" within the meaning of section 10.  If the Program as you
  575: received it, or any part of it, contains a notice stating that it is
  576: governed by this License along with a term that is a further
  577: restriction, you may remove that term.  If a license document contains
  578: a further restriction but permits relicensing or conveying under this
  579: License, you may add to a covered work material governed by the terms
  580: of that license document, provided that the further restriction does
  581: not survive such relicensing or conveying.
  582: 
  583:   If you add terms to a covered work in accord with this section, you
  584: must place, in the relevant source files, a statement of the
  585: additional terms that apply to those files, or a notice indicating
  586: where to find the applicable terms.
  587: 
  588:   Additional terms, permissive or non-permissive, may be stated in the
  589: form of a separately written license, or stated as exceptions;
  590: the above requirements apply either way.
  591: 
  592:   8. Termination.
  593: 
  594:   You may not propagate or modify a covered work except as expressly
  595: provided under this License.  Any attempt otherwise to propagate or
  596: modify it is void, and will automatically terminate your rights under
  597: this License (including any patent licenses granted under the third
  598: paragraph of section 11).
  599: 
  600:   However, if you cease all violation of this License, then your
  601: license from a particular copyright holder is reinstated (a)
  602: provisionally, unless and until the copyright holder explicitly and
  603: finally terminates your license, and (b) permanently, if the copyright
  604: holder fails to notify you of the violation by some reasonable means
  605: prior to 60 days after the cessation.
  606: 
  607:   Moreover, your license from a particular copyright holder is
  608: reinstated permanently if the copyright holder notifies you of the
  609: violation by some reasonable means, this is the first time you have
  610: received notice of violation of this License (for any work) from that
  611: copyright holder, and you cure the violation prior to 30 days after
  612: your receipt of the notice.
  613: 
  614:   Termination of your rights under this section does not terminate the
  615: licenses of parties who have received copies or rights from you under
  616: this License.  If your rights have been terminated and not permanently
  617: reinstated, you do not qualify to receive new licenses for the same
  618: material under section 10.
  619: 
  620:   9. Acceptance Not Required for Having Copies.
  621: 
  622:   You are not required to accept this License in order to receive or
  623: run a copy of the Program.  Ancillary propagation of a covered work
  624: occurring solely as a consequence of using peer-to-peer transmission
  625: to receive a copy likewise does not require acceptance.  However,
  626: nothing other than this License grants you permission to propagate or
  627: modify any covered work.  These actions infringe copyright if you do
  628: not accept this License.  Therefore, by modifying or propagating a
  629: covered work, you indicate your acceptance of this License to do so.
  630: 
  631:   10. Automatic Licensing of Downstream Recipients.
  632: 
  633:   Each time you convey a covered work, the recipient automatically
  634: receives a license from the original licensors, to run, modify and
  635: propagate that work, subject to this License.  You are not responsible
  636: for enforcing compliance by third parties with this License.
  637: 
  638:   An "entity transaction" is a transaction transferring control of an
  639: organization, or substantially all assets of one, or subdividing an
  640: organization, or merging organizations.  If propagation of a covered
  641: work results from an entity transaction, each party to that
  642: transaction who receives a copy of the work also receives whatever
  643: licenses to the work the party's predecessor in interest had or could
  644: give under the previous paragraph, plus a right to possession of the
  645: Corresponding Source of the work from the predecessor in interest, if
  646: the predecessor has it or can get it with reasonable efforts.
  647: 
  648:   You may not impose any further restrictions on the exercise of the
  649: rights granted or affirmed under this License.  For example, you may
  650: not impose a license fee, royalty, or other charge for exercise of
  651: rights granted under this License, and you may not initiate litigation
  652: (including a cross-claim or counterclaim in a lawsuit) alleging that
  653: any patent claim is infringed by making, using, selling, offering for
  654: sale, or importing the Program or any portion of it.
  655: 
  656:   11. Patents.
  657: 
  658:   A "contributor" is a copyright holder who authorizes use under this
  659: License of the Program or a work on which the Program is based.  The
  660: work thus licensed is called the contributor's "contributor version".
  661: 
  662:   A contributor's "essential patent claims" are all patent claims
  663: owned or controlled by the contributor, whether already acquired or
  664: hereafter acquired, that would be infringed by some manner, permitted
  665: by this License, of making, using, or selling its contributor version,
  666: but do not include claims that would be infringed only as a
  667: consequence of further modification of the contributor version.  For
  668: purposes of this definition, "control" includes the right to grant
  669: patent sublicenses in a manner consistent with the requirements of
  670: this License.
  671: 
  672:   Each contributor grants you a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free
  673: patent license under the contributor's essential patent claims, to
  674: make, use, sell, offer for sale, import and otherwise run, modify and
  675: propagate the contents of its contributor version.
  676: 
  677:   In the following three paragraphs, a "patent license" is any express
  678: agreement or commitment, however denominated, not to enforce a patent
  679: (such as an express permission to practice a patent or covenant not to
  680: sue for patent infringement).  To "grant" such a patent license to a
  681: party means to make such an agreement or commitment not to enforce a
  682: patent against the party.
  683: 
  684:   If you convey a covered work, knowingly relying on a patent license,
  685: and the Corresponding Source of the work is not available for anyone
  686: to copy, free of charge and under the terms of this License, through a
  687: publicly available network server or other readily accessible means,
  688: then you must either (1) cause the Corresponding Source to be so
  689: available, or (2) arrange to deprive yourself of the benefit of the
  690: patent license for this particular work, or (3) arrange, in a manner
  691: consistent with the requirements of this License, to extend the patent
  692: license to downstream recipients.  "Knowingly relying" means you have
  693: actual knowledge that, but for the patent license, your conveying the
  694: covered work in a country, or your recipient's use of the covered work
  695: in a country, would infringe one or more identifiable patents in that
  696: country that you have reason to believe are valid.
  697: 
  698:   If, pursuant to or in connection with a single transaction or
  699: arrangement, you convey, or propagate by procuring conveyance of, a
  700: covered work, and grant a patent license to some of the parties
  701: receiving the covered work authorizing them to use, propagate, modify
  702: or convey a specific copy of the covered work, then the patent license
  703: you grant is automatically extended to all recipients of the covered
  704: work and works based on it.
  705: 
  706:   A patent license is "discriminatory" if it does not include within
  707: the scope of its coverage, prohibits the exercise of, or is
  708: conditioned on the non-exercise of one or more of the rights that are
  709: specifically granted under this License.  You may not convey a covered
  710: work if you are a party to an arrangement with a third party that is
  711: in the business of distributing software, under which you make payment
  712: to the third party based on the extent of your activity of conveying
  713: the work, and under which the third party grants, to any of the
  714: parties who would receive the covered work from you, a discriminatory
  715: patent license (a) in connection with copies of the covered work
  716: conveyed by you (or copies made from those copies), or (b) primarily
  717: for and in connection with specific products or compilations that
  718: contain the covered work, unless you entered into that arrangement,
  719: or that patent license was granted, prior to 28 March 2007.
  720: 
  721:   Nothing in this License shall be construed as excluding or limiting
  722: any implied license or other defenses to infringement that may
  723: otherwise be available to you under applicable patent law.
  724: 
  725:   12. No Surrender of Others' Freedom.
  726: 
  727:   If conditions are imposed on you (whether by court order, agreement or
  728: otherwise) that contradict the conditions of this License, they do not
  729: excuse you from the conditions of this License.  If you cannot convey a
  730: covered work so as to satisfy simultaneously your obligations under this
  731: License and any other pertinent obligations, then as a consequence you may
  732: not convey it at all.  For example, if you agree to terms that obligate you
  733: to collect a royalty for further conveying from those to whom you convey
  734: the Program, the only way you could satisfy both those terms and this
  735: License would be to refrain entirely from conveying the Program.

  738:

  740: Program, your modified version must prominently offer all users

  742: supports such interaction) an opportunity to receive the Corresponding
  743: Source of your version by providing access to the Corresponding Source

  747: of the GNU General Public License that is incorporated pursuant to the
  748: following paragraph.

  818:             How to Apply These Terms to Your New Programs
  819: 
  820:   If you develop a new program, and you want it to be of the greatest
  821: possible use to the public, the best way to achieve this is to make it
  822: free software which everyone can redistribute and change under these terms.
  823: 
  824:   To do so, attach the following notices to the program.  It is safest
  825: to attach them to the start of each source file to most effectively
  826: state the exclusion of warranty; and each file should have at least
  827: the "copyright" line and a pointer to where the full notice is found.
  828: 
  829:     <one line to give the program's name and a brief idea of what it does.>
  830:     Copyright (C) <year>  <name of author>
  831: 
  832:     This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
  833:     it under the terms of the GNU Affero General Public License as published
  834:     by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or
  835:     (at your option) any later version.
  836: 
  837:     This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
  838:     but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
  839:     MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
  840:     GNU Affero General Public License for more details.
  841: 
  842:     You should have received a copy of the GNU Affero General Public License
  843:     along with this program.  If not, see <https://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
  844: 
  845: Also add information on how to contact you by electronic and paper mail.
  846: 
  847:   If your software can interact with users remotely through a computer
  848: network, you should also make sure that it provides a way for users to
  849: get its source.  For example, if your program is a web application, its
  850: interface could display a "Source" link that leads users to an archive
  851: of the code.  There are many ways you could offer source, and different
  852: solutions will be better for different programs; see section 13 for the
  853: specific requirements.
  854: 
  855:   You should also get your employer (if you work as a programmer) or school,
  856: if any, to sign a "copyright disclaimer" for the program, if necessary.
  857: For more information on this, and how to apply and follow the GNU AGPL, see
  858: <https://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.

  869: 
  870:    1. Definitions.
  871: 
  872:       "License" shall mean the terms and conditions for use, reproduction,
  873:       and distribution as defined by Sections 1 through 9 of this document.
  874: 
  875:       "Licensor" shall mean the copyright owner or entity authorized by
  876:       the copyright owner that is granting the License.
  877: 
  878:       "Legal Entity" shall mean the union of the acting entity and all
  879:       other entities that control, are controlled by, or are under common
  880:       control with that entity. For the purposes of this definition,
  881:       "control" means (i) the power, direct or indirect, to cause the
  882:       direction or management of such entity, whether by contract or
  883:       otherwise, or (ii) ownership of fifty percent (50%) or more of the
  884:       outstanding shares, or (iii) beneficial ownership of such entity.
  885: 
  886:       "You" (or "Your") shall mean an individual or Legal Entity
  887:       exercising permissions granted by this License.
  888: 
  889:       "Source" form shall mean the preferred form for making modifications,
  890:       including but not limited to software source code, documentation
  891:       source, and configuration files.
  892: 
  893:       "Object" form shall mean any form resulting from mechanical
  894:       transformation or translation of a Source form, including but
  895:       not limited to compiled object code, generated documentation,
  896:       and conversions to other media types.
  897: 
  898:       "Work" shall mean the work of authorship, whether in Source or
  899:       Object form, made available under the License, as indicated by a
  900:       copyright notice that is included in or attached to the work
  901:       (an example is provided in the Appendix below).
  902: 
  903:       "Derivative Works" shall mean any work, whether in Source or Object
  904:       form, that is based on (or derived from) the Work and for which the
  905:       editorial revisions, annotations, elaborations, or other modifications
  906:       represent, as a whole, an original work of authorship. For the purposes
  907:       of this License, Derivative Works shall not include works that remain
  908:       separable from, or merely link (or bind by name) to the interfaces of,
  909:       the Work and Derivative Works thereof.
  910: 
  911:       "Contribution" shall mean any work of authorship, including
  912:       the original version of the Work and any modifications or additions
  913:       to that Work or Derivative Works thereof, that is intentionally
  914:       submitted to Licensor for inclusion in the Work by the copyright owner
  915:       or by an individual or Legal Entity authorized to submit on behalf of
  916:       the copyright owner. For the purposes of this definition, "submitted"
  917:       means any form of electronic, verbal, or written communication sent
  918:       to the Licensor or its representatives, including but not limited to
  919:       communication on electronic mailing lists, source code control systems,
  920:       and issue tracking systems that are managed by, or on behalf of, the
  921:       Licensor for the purpose of discussing and improving the Work, but
  922:       excluding communication that is conspicuously marked or otherwise
  923:       designated in writing by the copyright owner as "Not a Contribution."
  924: 
  925:       "Contributor" shall mean Licensor and any individual or Legal Entity
  926:       on behalf of whom a Contribution has been received by Licensor and
  927:       subsequently incorporated within the Work.

  931:       worldwide, non-exclusive, no-charge, royalty-free, irrevocable
  932:       copyright license to reproduce, prepare Derivative Works of,
  933:       publicly display, publicly perform, sublicense, and distribute the
  934:       Work and such Derivative Works in Source or Object form.
  935: 
  936:    3. Grant of Patent License. Subject to the terms and conditions of
  937:       this License, each Contributor hereby grants to You a perpetual,
  938:       worldwide, non-exclusive, no-charge, royalty-free, irrevocable
  939:       (except as stated in this section) patent license to make, have made,
  940:       use, offer to sell, sell, import, and otherwise transfer the Work,
  941:       where such license applies only to those patent claims licensable
  942:       by such Contributor that are necessarily infringed by their
  943:       Contribution(s) alone or by combination of their Contribution(s)
  944:       with the Work to which such Contribution(s) was submitted. If You
  945:       institute patent litigation against any entity (including a
  946:       cross-claim or counterclaim in a lawsuit) alleging that the Work
  947:       or a Contribution incorporated within the Work constitutes direct
  948:       or contributory patent infringement, then any patent licenses
  949:       granted to You under this License for that Work shall terminate
  950:       as of the date such litigation is filed.
  951: 
  952:    4. Redistribution. You may reproduce and distribute copies of the
  953:       Work or Derivative Works thereof in any medium, with or without
  954:       modifications, and in Source or Object form, provided that You
  955:       meet the following conditions:
  956: 
  957:       (a) You must give any other recipients of the Work or
  958:           Derivative Works a copy of this License; and
  959: 
  960:       (b) You must cause any modified files to carry prominent notices
  961:           stating that You changed the files; and
  962: 
  963:       (c) You must retain, in the Source form of any Derivative Works
  964:           that You distribute, all copyright, patent, trademark, and
  965:           attribution notices from the Source form of the Work,
  966:           excluding those notices that do not pertain to any part of
  967:           the Derivative Works; and
  968: 
  969:       (d) If the Work includes a "NOTICE" text file as part of its
  970:           distribution, then any Derivative Works that You distribute must
  971:           include a readable copy of the attribution notices contained
  972:           within such NOTICE file, excluding those notices that do not
  973:           pertain to any part of the Derivative Works, in at least one
  974:           of the following places: within a NOTICE text file distributed
  975:           as part of the Derivative Works; within the Source form or
  976:           documentation, if provided along with the Derivative Works; or,
  977:           within a display generated by the Derivative Works, if and
  978:           wherever such third-party notices normally appear. The contents
  979:           of the NOTICE file are for informational purposes only and
  980:           do not modify the License. You may add Your own attribution
  981:           notices within Derivative Works that You distribute, alongside
  982:           or as an addendum to the NOTICE text from the Work, provided
  983:           that such additional attribution notices cannot be construed
  984:           as modifying the License.
  985: 
  986:       You may add Your own copyright statement to Your modifications and
  987:       may provide additional or different license terms and conditions
  988:       for use, reproduction, or distribution of Your modifications, or
  989:       for any such Derivative Works as a whole, provided Your use,
  990:       reproduction, and distribution of the Work otherwise complies with
  991:       the conditions stated in this License.
  992: 
  993:    5. Submission of Contributions. Unless You explicitly state otherwise,
  994:       any Contribution intentionally submitted for inclusion in the Work
  995:       by You to the Licensor shall be under the terms and conditions of
  996:       this License, without any additional terms or conditions.
  997:       Notwithstanding the above, nothing herein shall supersede or modify
  998:       the terms of any separate license agreement you may have executed
  999:       with Licensor regarding such Contributions.

 1002:       names, trademarks, service marks, or product names of the Licensor,
 1003:       except as required for reasonable and customary use in describing the

 1017:       whether in tort (including negligence), contract, or otherwise,

 1024:       work stoppage, computer failure or malfunction, or any and all
 1025:       other commercial damages or losses), even if such Contributor
 1026:       has been advised of the possibility of such damages.
 1027: 
 1028:    9. Accepting Warranty or Additional Liability. While redistributing
 1029:       the Work or Derivative Works thereof, You may choose to offer,
 1030:       and charge a fee for, acceptance of support, warranty, indemnity,
 1031:       or other liability obligations and/or rights consistent with this
 1032:       License. However, in accepting such obligations, You may act only
 1033:       on Your own behalf and on Your sole responsibility, not on behalf
 1034:       of any other Contributor, and only if You agree to indemnify,
 1035:       defend, and hold each Contributor harmless for any liability
 1036:       incurred by, or claims asserted against, such Contributor by reason
 1037:       of your accepting any such warranty or additional liability.
 1038: 
 1039:    END OF TERMS AND CONDITIONS
 1040: 
 1041:    APPENDIX: How to apply the Apache License to your work.
 1042: 
 1043:       To apply the Apache License to your work, attach the following
 1044:       boilerplate notice, with the fields enclosed by brackets "[]"
 1045:       replaced with your own identifying information. (Don't include
 1046:       the brackets!)  The text should be enclosed in the appropriate
 1047:       comment syntax for the file format. We also recommend that a
 1048:       file or class name and description of purpose be included on the
 1049:       same "printed page" as the copyright notice for easier
 1050:       identification within third-party archives.
 1051:

 1077: Preamble
 1078: 
 1079: This license establishes the terms under which a given free software
 1080: Package may be copied, modified, distributed, and/or redistributed.
 1081: The intent is that the Copyright Holder maintains some artistic
 1082: control over the development of that Package while still keeping the
 1083: Package available as open source and free software.
 1084: 
 1085: You are always permitted to make arrangements wholly outside of this
 1086: license directly with the Copyright Holder of a given Package.  If the
 1087: terms of this license do not permit the full use that you propose to
 1088: make of the Package, you should contact the Copyright Holder and seek
 1089: a different licensing arrangement.
 1090: 
 1091: Definitions
 1092: 
 1093:     "Copyright Holder" means the individual(s) or organization(s)
 1094:     named in the copyright notice for the entire Package.
 1095: 
 1096:     "Contributor" means any party that has contributed code or other
 1097:     material to the Package, in accordance with the Copyright Holder's
 1098:     procedures.
 1099: 
 1100:     "You" and "your" means any person who would like to copy,
 1101:     distribute, or modify the Package.
 1102: 
 1103:     "Package" means the collection of files distributed by the
 1104:     Copyright Holder, and derivatives of that collection and/or of
 1105:     those files. A given Package may consist of either the Standard
 1106:     Version, or a Modified Version.
 1107: 
 1108:     "Distribute" means providing a copy of the Package or making it
 1109:     accessible to anyone else, or in the case of a company or
 1110:     organization, to others outside of your company or organization.
 1111: 
 1112:     "Distributor Fee" means any fee that you charge for Distributing
 1113:     this Package or providing support for this Package to another
 1114:     party.  It does not mean licensing fees.
 1115: 
 1116:     "Standard Version" refers to the Package if it has not been
 1117:     modified, or has been modified only in ways explicitly requested
 1118:     by the Copyright Holder.
 1119: 
 1120:     "Modified Version" means the Package, if it has been changed, and
 1121:     such changes were not explicitly requested by the Copyright
 1122:     Holder.
 1123: 
 1124:     "Original License" means this Artistic License as Distributed with
 1125:     the Standard Version of the Package, in its current version or as
 1126:     it may be modified by The Perl Foundation in the future.
 1127: 
 1128:     "Source" form means the source code, documentation source, and
 1129:     configuration files for the Package.
 1130: 
 1131:     "Compiled" form means the compiled bytecode, object code, binary,
 1132:     or any other form resulting from mechanical transformation or
 1133:     translation of the Source form.
 1134: 
 1135: 
 1136: Permission for Use and Modification Without Distribution
 1137: 
 1138: (1)  You are permitted to use the Standard Version and create and use
 1139: Modified Versions for any purpose without restriction, provided that
 1140: you do not Distribute the Modified Version.
 1141: 
 1142: 
 1143: Permissions for Redistribution of the Standard Version
 1144: 
 1145: (2)  You may Distribute verbatim copies of the Source form of the
 1146: Standard Version of this Package in any medium without restriction,
 1147: either gratis or for a Distributor Fee, provided that you duplicate
 1148: all of the original copyright notices and associated disclaimers.  At
 1149: your discretion, such verbatim copies may or may not include a
 1150: Compiled form of the Package.
 1151: 
 1152: (3)  You may apply any bug fixes, portability changes, and other
 1153: modifications made available from the Copyright Holder.  The resulting
 1154: Package will still be considered the Standard Version, and as such
 1155: will be subject to the Original License.
 1156: 
 1157: 
 1158: Distribution of Modified Versions of the Package as Source
 1159: 
 1160: (4)  You may Distribute your Modified Version as Source (either gratis
 1161: or for a Distributor Fee, and with or without a Compiled form of the
 1162: Modified Version) provided that you clearly document how it differs
 1163: from the Standard Version, including, but not limited to, documenting
 1164: any non-standard features, executables, or modules, and provided that
 1165: you do at least ONE of the following:
 1166: 
 1167:     (a)  make the Modified Version available to the Copyright Holder
 1168:     of the Standard Version, under the Original License, so that the
 1169:     Copyright Holder may include your modifications in the Standard
 1170:     Version.
 1171: 
 1172:     (b)  ensure that installation of your Modified Version does not
 1173:     prevent the user installing or running the Standard Version. In
 1174:     addition, the Modified Version must bear a name that is different
 1175:     from the name of the Standard Version.
 1176: 
 1177:     (c)  allow anyone who receives a copy of the Modified Version to
 1178:     make the Source form of the Modified Version available to others
 1179:     under
 1180: 
 1181:     (i)  the Original License or
 1182: 
 1183:     (ii)  a license that permits the licensee to freely copy,
 1184:     modify and redistribute the Modified Version using the same
 1185:     licensing terms that apply to the copy that the licensee
 1186:     received, and requires that the Source form of the Modified
 1187:     Version, and of any works derived from it, be made freely
 1188:     available in that license fees are prohibited but Distributor
 1189:     Fees are allowed.
 1190: 
 1191: 
 1192: Distribution of Compiled Forms of the Standard Version
 1193: or Modified Versions without the Source
 1194: 
 1195: (5)  You may Distribute Compiled forms of the Standard Version without
 1196: the Source, provided that you include complete instructions on how to
 1197: get the Source of the Standard Version.  Such instructions must be
 1198: valid at the time of your distribution.  If these instructions, at any
 1199: time while you are carrying out such distribution, become invalid, you
 1200: must provide new instructions on demand or cease further distribution.
 1201: If you provide valid instructions or cease distribution within thirty
 1202: days after you become aware that the instructions are invalid, then
 1203: you do not forfeit any of your rights under this license.
 1204: 
 1205: (6)  You may Distribute a Modified Version in Compiled form without
 1206: the Source, provided that you comply with Section 4 with respect to
 1207: the Source of the Modified Version.
 1208: 
 1209: 
 1210: Aggregating or Linking the Package
 1211: 
 1212: (7)  You may aggregate the Package (either the Standard Version or
 1213: Modified Version) with other packages and Distribute the resulting
 1214: aggregation provided that you do not charge a licensing fee for the
 1215: Package.  Distributor Fees are permitted, and licensing fees for other
 1216: components in the aggregation are permitted. The terms of this license
 1217: apply to the use and Distribution of the Standard or Modified Versions
 1218: as included in the aggregation.
 1219: 
 1220: (8) You are permitted to link Modified and Standard Versions with
 1221: other works, to embed the Package in a larger work of your own, or to
 1222: build stand-alone binary or bytecode versions of applications that
 1223: include the Package, and Distribute the result without restriction,
 1224: provided the result does not expose a direct interface to the Package.
 1225: 
 1226: 
 1227: Items That are Not Considered Part of a Modified Version
 1228: 
 1229: (9) Works (including, but not limited to, modules and scripts) that
 1230: merely extend or make use of the Package, do not, by themselves, cause
 1231: the Package to be a Modified Version.  In addition, such works are not
 1232: considered parts of the Package itself, and are not subject to the
 1233: terms of this license.

 1421: Creative Commons public licenses provide a standard set of terms and
 1422: conditions that creators and other rights holders may use to share
 1423: original works of authorship and other material subject to copyright
 1424: and certain other rights specified in the public license below. The
 1425: following considerations are for informational purposes only, are not
 1426: exhaustive, and do not form part of our licenses.
 1427: 
 1428:      Considerations for licensors: Our public licenses are
 1429:      intended for use by those authorized to give the public
 1430:      permission to use material in ways otherwise restricted by
 1431:      copyright and certain other rights. Our licenses are
 1432:      irrevocable. Licensors should read and understand the terms
 1433:      and conditions of the license they choose before applying it.
 1434:      Licensors should also secure all rights necessary before
 1435:      applying our licenses so that the public can reuse the
 1436:      material as expected. Licensors should clearly mark any
 1437:      material not subject to the license. This includes other CC-
 1438:      licensed material, or material used under an exception or
 1439:      limitation to copyright. More considerations for licensors:
 1440:     wiki.creativecommons.org/Considerations_for_licensors
 1441: 
 1442:      Considerations for the public: By using one of our public
 1443:      licenses, a licensor grants the public permission to use the
 1444:      licensed material under specified terms and conditions. If
 1445:      the licensor's permission is not necessary for any reason--for
 1446:      example, because of any applicable exception or limitation to
 1447:      copyright--then that use is not regulated by the license. Our
 1448:      licenses grant only permissions under copyright and certain
 1449:      other rights that a licensor has authority to grant. Use of
 1450:      the licensed material may still be restricted for other
 1451:      reasons, including because others have copyright or other
 1452:      rights in the material. A licensor may make special requests,
 1453:      such as asking that all changes be marked or described.
 1454:      Although not required by our licenses, you are encouraged to
 1455:      respect those requests where reasonable. More_considerations
 1456:      for the public:
 1457:     wiki.creativecommons.org/Considerations_for_licensees

 1463: By exercising the Licensed Rights (defined below), You accept and agree
 1464: to be bound by the terms and conditions of this Creative Commons
 1465: Attribution 4.0 International Public License ("Public License"). To the
 1466: extent this Public License may be interpreted as a contract, You are
 1467: granted the Licensed Rights in consideration of Your acceptance of
 1468: these terms and conditions, and the Licensor grants You such rights in
 1469: consideration of benefits the Licensor receives from making the
 1470: Licensed Material available under these terms and conditions.
 1471: 
 1472: 
 1473: Section 1 -- Definitions.
 1474: 
 1475:   a. Adapted Material means material subject to Copyright and Similar
 1476:      Rights that is derived from or based upon the Licensed Material
 1477:      and in which the Licensed Material is translated, altered,
 1478:      arranged, transformed, or otherwise modified in a manner requiring
 1479:      permission under the Copyright and Similar Rights held by the
 1480:      Licensor. For purposes of this Public License, where the Licensed
 1481:      Material is a musical work, performance, or sound recording,
 1482:      Adapted Material is always produced where the Licensed Material is
 1483:      synched in timed relation with a moving image.
 1484: 
 1485:   b. Adapter's License means the license You apply to Your Copyright
 1486:      and Similar Rights in Your contributions to Adapted Material in
 1487:      accordance with the terms and conditions of this Public License.
 1488: 
 1489:   c. Copyright and Similar Rights means copyright and/or similar rights
 1490:      closely related to copyright including, without limitation,
 1491:      performance, broadcast, sound recording, and Sui Generis Database
 1492:      Rights, without regard to how the rights are labeled or
 1493:      categorized. For purposes of this Public License, the rights
 1494:      specified in Section 2(b)(1)-(2) are not Copyright and Similar
 1495:      Rights.
 1496: 
 1497:   d. Effective Technological Measures means those measures that, in the
 1498:      absence of proper authority, may not be circumvented under laws
 1499:      fulfilling obligations under Article 11 of the WIPO Copyright
 1500:      Treaty adopted on December 20, 1996, and/or similar international
 1501:      agreements.
 1502: 
 1503:   e. Exceptions and Limitations means fair use, fair dealing, and/or
 1504:      any other exception or limitation to Copyright and Similar Rights
 1505:      that applies to Your use of the Licensed Material.
 1506: 
 1507:   f. Licensed Material means the artistic or literary work, database,
 1508:      or other material to which the Licensor applied this Public
 1509:      License.
 1510: 
 1511:   g. Licensed Rights means the rights granted to You subject to the
 1512:      terms and conditions of this Public License, which are limited to
 1513:      all Copyright and Similar Rights that apply to Your use of the
 1514:      Licensed Material and that the Licensor has authority to license.
 1515: 
 1516:   h. Licensor means the individual(s) or entity(ies) granting rights
 1517:      under this Public License.
 1518: 
 1519:   i. Share means to provide material to the public by any means or
 1520:      process that requires permission under the Licensed Rights, such
 1521:      as reproduction, public display, public performance, distribution,
 1522:      dissemination, communication, or importation, and to make material
 1523:      available to the public including in ways that members of the
 1524:      public may access the material from a place and at a time
 1525:      individually chosen by them.
 1526: 
 1527:   j. Sui Generis Database Rights means rights other than copyright
 1528:      resulting from Directive 96/9/EC of the European Parliament and of
 1529:      the Council of 11 March 1996 on the legal protection of databases,
 1530:      as amended and/or succeeded, as well as other essentially
 1531:      equivalent rights anywhere in the world.
 1532: 
 1533:   k. You means the individual or entity exercising the Licensed Rights
 1534:      under this Public License. Your has a corresponding meaning.
 1535: 
 1536: 
 1537: Section 2 -- Scope.
 1538: 
 1539:   a. License grant.
 1540: 
 1541:        1. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Public License,
 1542:           the Licensor hereby grants You a worldwide, royalty-free,
 1543:           non-sublicensable, non-exclusive, irrevocable license to
 1544:           exercise the Licensed Rights in the Licensed Material to:
 1545: 
 1546:             a. reproduce and Share the Licensed Material, in whole or
 1547:                in part; and
 1548: 
 1549:             b. produce, reproduce, and Share Adapted Material.
 1550: 
 1551:        2. Exceptions and Limitations. For the avoidance of doubt, where
 1552:           Exceptions and Limitations apply to Your use, this Public
 1553:           License does not apply, and You do not need to comply with
 1554:           its terms and conditions.
 1555: 
 1556:        3. Term. The term of this Public License is specified in Section
 1557:           6(a).
 1558: 
 1559:        4. Media and formats; technical modifications allowed. The
 1560:           Licensor authorizes You to exercise the Licensed Rights in
 1561:           all media and formats whether now known or hereafter created,
 1562:           and to make technical modifications necessary to do so. The
 1563:           Licensor waives and/or agrees not to assert any right or
 1564:           authority to forbid You from making technical modifications
 1565:           necessary to exercise the Licensed Rights, including
 1566:           technical modifications necessary to circumvent Effective
 1567:           Technological Measures. For purposes of this Public License,
 1568:           simply making modifications authorized by this Section 2(a)
 1569:           (4) never produces Adapted Material.
 1570: 
 1571:        5. Downstream recipients.
 1572: 
 1573:             a. Offer from the Licensor -- Licensed Material. Every
 1574:                recipient of the Licensed Material automatically
 1575:                receives an offer from the Licensor to exercise the
 1576:                Licensed Rights under the terms and conditions of this
 1577:                Public License.
 1578: 
 1579:             b. No downstream restrictions. You may not offer or impose
 1580:                any additional or different terms or conditions on, or
 1581:                apply any Effective Technological Measures to, the
 1582:                Licensed Material if doing so restricts exercise of the
 1583:                Licensed Rights by any recipient of the Licensed
 1584:                Material.
 1585: 
 1586:        6. No endorsement. Nothing in this Public License constitutes or
 1587:           may be construed as permission to assert or imply that You
 1588:           are, or that Your use of the Licensed Material is, connected
 1589:           with, or sponsored, endorsed, or granted official status by,
 1590:           the Licensor or others designated to receive attribution as
 1591:           provided in Section 3(a)(1)(A)(i).
 1592: 
 1593:   b. Other rights.
 1594: 
 1595:        1. Moral rights, such as the right of integrity, are not
 1596:           licensed under this Public License, nor are publicity,
 1597:           privacy, and/or other similar personality rights; however, to
 1598:           the extent possible, the Licensor waives and/or agrees not to
 1599:           assert any such rights held by the Licensor to the limited
 1600:           extent necessary to allow You to exercise the Licensed
 1601:           Rights, but not otherwise.
 1602: 
 1603:        2. Patent and trademark rights are not licensed under this
 1604:           Public License.
 1605: 
 1606:        3. To the extent possible, the Licensor waives any right to
 1607:           collect royalties from You for the exercise of the Licensed
 1608:           Rights, whether directly or through a collecting society
 1609:           under any voluntary or waivable statutory or compulsory
 1610:           licensing scheme. In all other cases the Licensor expressly
 1611:           reserves any right to collect such royalties.
 1612: 
 1613: 
 1614: Section 3 -- License Conditions.
 1615: 
 1616: Your exercise of the Licensed Rights is expressly made subject to the
 1617: following conditions.
 1618: 
 1619:   a. Attribution.
 1620: 
 1621:        1. If You Share the Licensed Material (including in modified
 1622:           form), You must:
 1623: 
 1624:             a. retain the following if it is supplied by the Licensor
 1625:                with the Licensed Material:
 1626: 
 1627:                  i. identification of the creator(s) of the Licensed
 1628:                     Material and any others designated to receive
 1629:                     attribution, in any reasonable manner requested by
 1630:                     the Licensor (including by pseudonym if
 1631:                     designated);
 1632: 
 1633:                 ii. a copyright notice;
 1634: 
 1635:                iii. a notice that refers to this Public License;
 1636: 
 1637:                 iv. a notice that refers to the disclaimer of
 1638:                     warranties;
 1639: 
 1640:                  v. a URI or hyperlink to the Licensed Material to the
 1641:                     extent reasonably practicable;
 1642: 
 1643:             b. indicate if You modified the Licensed Material and
 1644:                retain an indication of any previous modifications; and
 1645: 
 1646:             c. indicate the Licensed Material is licensed under this
 1647:                Public License, and include the text of, or the URI or
 1648:                hyperlink to, this Public License.
 1649: 
 1650:        2. You may satisfy the conditions in Section 3(a)(1) in any
 1651:           reasonable manner based on the medium, means, and context in
 1652:           which You Share the Licensed Material. For example, it may be
 1653:           reasonable to satisfy the conditions by providing a URI or
 1654:           hyperlink to a resource that includes the required
 1655:           information.
 1656: 
 1657:        3. If requested by the Licensor, You must remove any of the
 1658:           information required by Section 3(a)(1)(A) to the extent
 1659:           reasonably practicable.
 1660: 
 1661:        4. If You Share Adapted Material You produce, the Adapter's
 1662:           License You apply must not prevent recipients of the Adapted
 1663:           Material from complying with this Public License.
 1664: 
 1665: 
 1666: Section 4 -- Sui Generis Database Rights.
 1667: 
 1668: Where the Licensed Rights include Sui Generis Database Rights that
 1669: apply to Your use of the Licensed Material:
 1670: 
 1671:   a. for the avoidance of doubt, Section 2(a)(1) grants You the right
 1672:      to extract, reuse, reproduce, and Share all or a substantial
 1673:      portion of the contents of the database;
 1674: 
 1675:   b. if You include all or a substantial portion of the database
 1676:      contents in a database in which You have Sui Generis Database
 1677:      Rights, then the database in which You have Sui Generis Database
 1678:      Rights (but not its individual contents) is Adapted Material; and
 1679: 
 1680:   c. You must comply with the conditions in Section 3(a) if You Share
 1681:      all or a substantial portion of the contents of the database.
 1682: 
 1683: For the avoidance of doubt, this Section 4 supplements and does not
 1684: replace Your obligations under this Public License where the Licensed
 1685: Rights include other Copyright and Similar Rights.
 1686: 
 1687: 
 1688: Section 5 -- Disclaimer of Warranties and Limitation of Liability.
 1689: 
 1690:   a. UNLESS OTHERWISE SEPARATELY UNDERTAKEN BY THE LICENSOR, TO THE
 1691:      EXTENT POSSIBLE, THE LICENSOR OFFERS THE LICENSED MATERIAL AS-IS
 1692:      AND AS-AVAILABLE, AND MAKES NO REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES OF
 1693:      ANY KIND CONCERNING THE LICENSED MATERIAL, WHETHER EXPRESS,
 1694:      IMPLIED, STATUTORY, OR OTHER. THIS INCLUDES, WITHOUT LIMITATION,
 1695:      WARRANTIES OF TITLE, MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR
 1696:      PURPOSE, NON-INFRINGEMENT, ABSENCE OF LATENT OR OTHER DEFECTS,
 1697:      ACCURACY, OR THE PRESENCE OR ABSENCE OF ERRORS, WHETHER OR NOT
 1698:      KNOWN OR DISCOVERABLE. WHERE DISCLAIMERS OF WARRANTIES ARE NOT
 1699:      ALLOWED IN FULL OR IN PART, THIS DISCLAIMER MAY NOT APPLY TO YOU.
 1700: 
 1701:   b. TO THE EXTENT POSSIBLE, IN NO EVENT WILL THE LICENSOR BE LIABLE
 1702:      TO YOU ON ANY LEGAL THEORY (INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION,
 1703:      NEGLIGENCE) OR OTHERWISE FOR ANY DIRECT, SPECIAL, INDIRECT,
 1704:      INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, PUNITIVE, EXEMPLARY, OR OTHER LOSSES,
 1705:      COSTS, EXPENSES, OR DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF THIS PUBLIC LICENSE OR
 1706:      USE OF THE LICENSED MATERIAL, EVEN IF THE LICENSOR HAS BEEN
 1707:      ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH LOSSES, COSTS, EXPENSES, OR
 1708:      DAMAGES. WHERE A LIMITATION OF LIABILITY IS NOT ALLOWED IN FULL OR
 1709:      IN PART, THIS LIMITATION MAY NOT APPLY TO YOU.
 1710: 
 1711:   c. The disclaimer of warranties and limitation of liability provided
 1712:      above shall be interpreted in a manner that, to the extent
 1713:      possible, most closely approximates an absolute disclaimer and
 1714:      waiver of all liability.
 1715: 
 1716: 
 1717: Section 6 -- Term and Termination.
 1718: 
 1719:   a. This Public License applies for the term of the Copyright and
 1720:      Similar Rights licensed here. However, if You fail to comply with
 1721:      this Public License, then Your rights under this Public License
 1722:      terminate automatically.
 1723: 
 1724:   b. Where Your right to use the Licensed Material has terminated under
 1725:      Section 6(a), it reinstates:
 1726: 
 1727:        1. automatically as of the date the violation is cured, provided
 1728:           it is cured within 30 days of Your discovery of the
 1729:           violation; or
 1730: 
 1731:        2. upon express reinstatement by the Licensor.
 1732: 
 1733:      For the avoidance of doubt, this Section 6(b) does not affect any
 1734:      right the Licensor may have to seek remedies for Your violations
 1735:      of this Public License.
 1736: 
 1737:   c. For the avoidance of doubt, the Licensor may also offer the
 1738:      Licensed Material under separate terms or conditions or stop
 1739:      distributing the Licensed Material at any time; however, doing so
 1740:      will not terminate this Public License.
 1741: 
 1742:   d. Sections 1, 5, 6, 7, and 8 survive termination of this Public
 1743:      License.
 1744: 
 1745: 
 1746: Section 7 -- Other Terms and Conditions.
 1747: 
 1748:   a. The Licensor shall not be bound by any additional or different
 1749:      terms or conditions communicated by You unless expressly agreed.
 1750: 
 1751:   b. Any arrangements, understandings, or agreements regarding the
 1752:      Licensed Material not stated herein are separate from and
 1753:      independent of the terms and conditions of this Public License.
 1754: 
 1755: 
 1756: Section 8 -- Interpretation.
 1757: 
 1758:   a. For the avoidance of doubt, this Public License does not, and
 1759:      shall not be interpreted to, reduce, limit, restrict, or impose
 1760:      conditions on any use of the Licensed Material that could lawfully
 1761:      be made without permission under this Public License.
 1762: 
 1763:   b. To the extent possible, if any provision of this Public License is
 1764:      deemed unenforceable, it shall be automatically reformed to the
 1765:      minimum extent necessary to make it enforceable. If the provision
 1766:      cannot be reformed, it shall be severed from this Public License
 1767:      without affecting the enforceability of the remaining terms and
 1768:      conditions.
 1769: 
 1770:   c. No term or condition of this Public License will be waived and no
 1771:      failure to comply consented to unless expressly agreed to by the
 1772:      Licensor.
 1773: 
 1774:   d. Nothing in this Public License constitutes or may be interpreted
 1775:      as a limitation upon, or waiver of, any privileges and immunities
 1776:      that apply to the Licensor or You, including from the legal
 1777:      processes of any jurisdiction or authority.

 1810: does not provide legal services or legal advice. Distribution of
 1811: Creative Commons public licenses does not create a lawyer-client or
 1812: other relationship. Creative Commons makes its licenses and related
 1813: information available on an "as-is" basis. Creative Commons gives no
 1814: warranties regarding its licenses, any material licensed under their
 1815: terms and conditions, or any related information. Creative Commons
 1816: disclaims all liability for damages resulting from their use to the
 1817: fullest extent possible.
 1818: 
 1819: Using Creative Commons Public Licenses
 1820: 
 1821: Creative Commons public licenses provide a standard set of terms and
 1822: conditions that creators and other rights holders may use to share
 1823: original works of authorship and other material subject to copyright
 1824: and certain other rights specified in the public license below. The
 1825: following considerations are for informational purposes only, are not
 1826: exhaustive, and do not form part of our licenses.
 1827: 
 1828:      Considerations for licensors: Our public licenses are
 1829:      intended for use by those authorized to give the public
 1830:      permission to use material in ways otherwise restricted by
 1831:      copyright and certain other rights. Our licenses are
 1832:      irrevocable. Licensors should read and understand the terms
 1833:      and conditions of the license they choose before applying it.
 1834:      Licensors should also secure all rights necessary before
 1835:      applying our licenses so that the public can reuse the
 1836:      material as expected. Licensors should clearly mark any
 1837:      material not subject to the license. This includes other CC-
 1838:      licensed material, or material used under an exception or
 1839:      limitation to copyright. More considerations for licensors:
 1840:     wiki.creativecommons.org/Considerations_for_licensors
 1841: 
 1842:      Considerations for the public: By using one of our public
 1843:      licenses, a licensor grants the public permission to use the
 1844:      licensed material under specified terms and conditions. If
 1845:      the licensor's permission is not necessary for any reason--for
 1846:      example, because of any applicable exception or limitation to
 1847:      copyright--then that use is not regulated by the license. Our
 1848:      licenses grant only permissions under copyright and certain
 1849:      other rights that a licensor has authority to grant. Use of
 1850:      the licensed material may still be restricted for other
 1851:      reasons, including because others have copyright or other
 1852:      rights in the material. A licensor may make special requests,
 1853:      such as asking that all changes be marked or described.
 1854:      Although not required by our licenses, you are encouraged to
 1855:      respect those requests where reasonable. More_considerations
 1856:      for the public:
 1857:     wiki.creativecommons.org/Considerations_for_licensees
