 1867: License"). To the extent this Public License may be interpreted as a
 1868: contract, You are granted the Licensed Rights in consideration of Your
 1869: acceptance of these terms and conditions, and the Licensor grants You
 1870: such rights in consideration of benefits the Licensor receives from
 1871: making the Licensed Material available under these terms and
 1872: conditions.
 1873: 
 1874: 
 1875: Section 1 -- Definitions.
 1876: 
 1877:   a. Adapted Material means material subject to Copyright and Similar
 1878:      Rights that is derived from or based upon the Licensed Material
 1879:      and in which the Licensed Material is translated, altered,
 1880:      arranged, transformed, or otherwise modified in a manner requiring
 1881:      permission under the Copyright and Similar Rights held by the
 1882:      Licensor. For purposes of this Public License, where the Licensed
 1883:      Material is a musical work, performance, or sound recording,
 1884:      Adapted Material is always produced where the Licensed Material is
 1885:      synched in timed relation with a moving image.
 1886: 
 1887:   b. Adapter's License means the license You apply to Your Copyright
 1888:      and Similar Rights in Your contributions to Adapted Material in
 1889:      accordance with the terms and conditions of this Public License.
 1890: 
 1891:   c. BY-SA Compatible License means a license listed at
 1892:      creativecommons.org/compatiblelicenses, approved by Creative
 1893:      Commons as essentially the equivalent of this Public License.
 1894: 
 1895:   d. Copyright and Similar Rights means copyright and/or similar rights
 1896:      closely related to copyright including, without limitation,
 1897:      performance, broadcast, sound recording, and Sui Generis Database
 1898:      Rights, without regard to how the rights are labeled or
 1899:      categorized. For purposes of this Public License, the rights
 1900:      specified in Section 2(b)(1)-(2) are not Copyright and Similar
 1901:      Rights.
 1902: 
 1903:   e. Effective Technological Measures means those measures that, in the
 1904:      absence of proper authority, may not be circumvented under laws
 1905:      fulfilling obligations under Article 11 of the WIPO Copyright
 1906:      Treaty adopted on December 20, 1996, and/or similar international
 1907:      agreements.
 1908: 
 1909:   f. Exceptions and Limitations means fair use, fair dealing, and/or
 1910:      any other exception or limitation to Copyright and Similar Rights
 1911:      that applies to Your use of the Licensed Material.
 1912: 
 1913:   g. License Elements means the license attributes listed in the name
 1914:      of a Creative Commons Public License. The License Elements of this
 1915:      Public License are Attribution and ShareAlike.
 1916: 
 1917:   h. Licensed Material means the artistic or literary work, database,
 1918:      or other material to which the Licensor applied this Public
 1919:      License.
 1920: 
 1921:   i. Licensed Rights means the rights granted to You subject to the
 1922:      terms and conditions of this Public License, which are limited to
 1923:      all Copyright and Similar Rights that apply to Your use of the
 1924:      Licensed Material and that the Licensor has authority to license.
 1925: 
 1926:   j. Licensor means the individual(s) or entity(ies) granting rights
 1927:      under this Public License.
 1928: 
 1929:   k. Share means to provide material to the public by any means or
 1930:      process that requires permission under the Licensed Rights, such
 1931:      as reproduction, public display, public performance, distribution,
 1932:      dissemination, communication, or importation, and to make material
 1933:      available to the public including in ways that members of the
 1934:      public may access the material from a place and at a time
 1935:      individually chosen by them.
 1936: 
 1937:   l. Sui Generis Database Rights means rights other than copyright
 1938:      resulting from Directive 96/9/EC of the European Parliament and of
 1939:      the Council of 11 March 1996 on the legal protection of databases,
 1940:      as amended and/or succeeded, as well as other essentially
 1941:      equivalent rights anywhere in the world.
 1942: 
 1943:   m. You means the individual or entity exercising the Licensed Rights
 1944:      under this Public License. Your has a corresponding meaning.
 1945: 
 1946: 
 1947: Section 2 -- Scope.
 1948: 
 1949:   a. License grant.
 1950: 
 1951:        1. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Public License,
 1952:           the Licensor hereby grants You a worldwide, royalty-free,
 1953:           non-sublicensable, non-exclusive, irrevocable license to
 1954:           exercise the Licensed Rights in the Licensed Material to:
 1955: 
 1956:             a. reproduce and Share the Licensed Material, in whole or
 1957:                in part; and
 1958: 
 1959:             b. produce, reproduce, and Share Adapted Material.
 1960: 
 1961:        2. Exceptions and Limitations. For the avoidance of doubt, where
 1962:           Exceptions and Limitations apply to Your use, this Public
 1963:           License does not apply, and You do not need to comply with
 1964:           its terms and conditions.
 1965: 
 1966:        3. Term. The term of this Public License is specified in Section
 1967:           6(a).
 1968: 
 1969:        4. Media and formats; technical modifications allowed. The
 1970:           Licensor authorizes You to exercise the Licensed Rights in
 1971:           all media and formats whether now known or hereafter created,
 1972:           and to make technical modifications necessary to do so. The
 1973:           Licensor waives and/or agrees not to assert any right or
 1974:           authority to forbid You from making technical modifications
 1975:           necessary to exercise the Licensed Rights, including
 1976:           technical modifications necessary to circumvent Effective
 1977:           Technological Measures. For purposes of this Public License,
 1978:           simply making modifications authorized by this Section 2(a)
 1979:           (4) never produces Adapted Material.
 1980: 
 1981:        5. Downstream recipients.
 1982: 
 1983:             a. Offer from the Licensor -- Licensed Material. Every
 1984:                recipient of the Licensed Material automatically
 1985:                receives an offer from the Licensor to exercise the
 1986:                Licensed Rights under the terms and conditions of this
 1987:                Public License.
 1988: 
 1989:             b. Additional offer from the Licensor -- Adapted Material.
 1990:                Every recipient of Adapted Material from You
 1991:                automatically receives an offer from the Licensor to
 1992:                exercise the Licensed Rights in the Adapted Material
 1993:                under the conditions of the Adapter's License You apply.
 1994: 
 1995:             c. No downstream restrictions. You may not offer or impose
 1996:                any additional or different terms or conditions on, or
 1997:                apply any Effective Technological Measures to, the
 1998:                Licensed Material if doing so restricts exercise of the
 1999:                Licensed Rights by any recipient of the Licensed
 2000:                Material.
 2001: 
 2002:        6. No endorsement. Nothing in this Public License constitutes or
 2003:           may be construed as permission to assert or imply that You
 2004:           are, or that Your use of the Licensed Material is, connected
 2005:           with, or sponsored, endorsed, or granted official status by,
 2006:           the Licensor or others designated to receive attribution as
 2007:           provided in Section 3(a)(1)(A)(i).
 2008: 
 2009:   b. Other rights.
 2010: 
 2011:        1. Moral rights, such as the right of integrity, are not
 2012:           licensed under this Public License, nor are publicity,
 2013:           privacy, and/or other similar personality rights; however, to
 2014:           the extent possible, the Licensor waives and/or agrees not to
 2015:           assert any such rights held by the Licensor to the limited
 2016:           extent necessary to allow You to exercise the Licensed
 2017:           Rights, but not otherwise.

 2183:   b. Any arrangements, understandings, or agreements regarding the
 2184:      Licensed Material not stated herein are separate from and
 2185:      independent of the terms and conditions of this Public License.
 2186: 
 2187: 
 2188: Section 8 -- Interpretation.
 2189: 
 2190:   a. For the avoidance of doubt, this Public License does not, and
 2191:      shall not be interpreted to, reduce, limit, restrict, or impose
 2192:      conditions on any use of the Licensed Material that could lawfully
 2193:      be made without permission under this Public License.
 2194: 
 2195:   b. To the extent possible, if any provision of this Public License is
 2196:      deemed unenforceable, it shall be automatically reformed to the
 2197:      minimum extent necessary to make it enforceable. If the provision
 2198:      cannot be reformed, it shall be severed from this Public License
 2199:      without affecting the enforceability of the remaining terms and
 2200:      conditions.
 2201: 
 2202:   c. No term or condition of this Public License will be waived and no
 2203:      failure to comply consented to unless expressly agreed to by the
 2204:      Licensor.
 2205: 
 2206:   d. Nothing in this Public License constitutes or may be interpreted
 2207:      as a limitation upon, or waiver of, any privileges and immunities
 2208:      that apply to the Licensor or You, including from the legal
 2209:      processes of any jurisdiction or authority.

 2239: Statement of Purpose
 2240: 
 2241: The laws of most jurisdictions throughout the world automatically confer
 2242: exclusive Copyright and Related Rights (defined below) upon the creator and
 2243: subsequent owner(s) (each and all, an "owner") of an original work of
 2244: authorship and/or a database (each, a "Work").
 2245: 
 2246: Certain owners wish to permanently relinquish those rights to a Work for the
 2247: purpose of contributing to a commons of creative, cultural and scientific
 2248: works ("Commons") that the public can reliably and without fear of later
 2249: claims of infringement build upon, modify, incorporate in other works, reuse
 2250: and redistribute as freely as possible in any form whatsoever and for any
 2251: purposes, including without limitation commercial purposes. These owners may
 2252: contribute to the Commons to promote the ideal of a free culture and the
 2253: further production of creative, cultural and scientific works, or to gain
 2254: reputation or greater distribution for their Work in part through the use and
 2255: efforts of others.
 2256: 
 2257: For these and/or other purposes and motivations, and without any expectation
 2258: of additional consideration or compensation, the person associating CC0 with a
 2259: Work (the "Affirmer"), to the extent that he or she is an owner of Copyright
 2260: and Related Rights in the Work, voluntarily elects to apply CC0 to the Work
 2261: and publicly distribute the Work under its terms, with knowledge of his or her
 2262: Copyright and Related Rights in the Work and the meaning and intended legal
 2263: effect of CC0 on those rights.
 2264: 
 2265: 1. Copyright and Related Rights. A Work made available under CC0 may be
 2266: protected by copyright and related or neighboring rights ("Copyright and
 2267: Related Rights"). Copyright and Related Rights include, but are not limited
 2268: to, the following:
 2269: 
 2270:   i. the right to reproduce, adapt, distribute, perform, display, communicate,
 2271:   and translate a Work;
 2272: 
 2273:   ii. moral rights retained by the original author(s) and/or performer(s);
 2274: 
 2275:   iii. publicity and privacy rights pertaining to a person's image or likeness
 2276:   depicted in a Work;
 2277: 
 2278:   iv. rights protecting against unfair competition in regards to a Work,
 2279:   subject to the limitations in paragraph 4(a), below;
 2280: 
 2281:   v. rights protecting the extraction, dissemination, use and reuse of data in
 2282:   a Work;
 2283: 
 2284:   vi. database rights (such as those arising under Directive 96/9/EC of the
 2285:   European Parliament and of the Council of 11 March 1996 on the legal
 2286:   protection of databases, and under any national implementation thereof,
 2287:   including any amended or successor version of such directive); and
 2288: 
 2289:   vii. other similar, equivalent or corresponding rights throughout the world
 2290:   based on applicable law or treaty, and any national implementations thereof.
 2291: 
 2292: 2. Waiver. To the greatest extent permitted by, but not in contravention of,
 2293: applicable law, Affirmer hereby overtly, fully, permanently, irrevocably and
 2294: unconditionally waives, abandons, and surrenders all of Affirmer's Copyright
 2295: and Related Rights and associated claims and causes of action, whether now
 2296: known or unknown (including existing as well as future claims and causes of
 2297: action), in the Work (i) in all territories worldwide, (ii) for the maximum
 2298: duration provided by applicable law or treaty (including future time
 2299: extensions), (iii) in any current or future medium and for any number of
 2300: copies, and (iv) for any purpose whatsoever, including without limitation
 2301: commercial, advertising or promotional purposes (the "Waiver"). Affirmer makes
 2302: the Waiver for the benefit of each member of the public at large and to the
 2303: detriment of Affirmer's heirs and successors, fully intending that such Waiver
 2304: shall not be subject to revocation, rescission, cancellation, termination, or
 2305: any other legal or equitable action to disrupt the quiet enjoyment of the Work
 2306: by the public as contemplated by Affirmer's express Statement of Purpose.
 2307: 
 2308: 3. Public License Fallback. Should any part of the Waiver for any reason be
 2309: judged legally invalid or ineffective under applicable law, then the Waiver
 2310: shall be preserved to the maximum extent permitted taking into account
 2311: Affirmer's express Statement of Purpose. In addition, to the extent the Waiver
 2312: is so judged Affirmer hereby grants to each affected person a royalty-free,
 2313: non transferable, non sublicensable, non exclusive, irrevocable and
 2314: unconditional license to exercise Affirmer's Copyright and Related Rights in
 2315: the Work (i) in all territories worldwide, (ii) for the maximum duration
 2316: provided by applicable law or treaty (including future time extensions), (iii)
 2317: in any current or future medium and for any number of copies, and (iv) for any
 2318: purpose whatsoever, including without limitation commercial, advertising or
 2319: promotional purposes (the "License"). The License shall be deemed effective as
 2320: of the date CC0 was applied by Affirmer to the Work. Should any part of the
 2321: License for any reason be judged legally invalid or ineffective under
 2322: applicable law, such partial invalidity or ineffectiveness shall not
 2323: invalidate the remainder of the License, and in such case Affirmer hereby
 2324: affirms that he or she will not (i) exercise any of his or her remaining
 2325: Copyright and Related Rights in the Work or (ii) assert any associated claims
 2326: and causes of action with respect to the Work, in either case contrary to
 2327: Affirmer's express Statement of Purpose.
 2328: 
 2329: 4. Limitations and Disclaimers.
 2330: 
 2331:   a. No trademark or patent rights held by Affirmer are waived, abandoned,
 2332:   surrendered, licensed or otherwise affected by this document.
 2333: 
 2334:   b. Affirmer offers the Work as-is and makes no representations or warranties
 2335:   of any kind concerning the Work, express, implied, statutory or otherwise,
 2336:   including without limitation warranties of title, merchantability, fitness
 2337:   for a particular purpose, non infringement, or the absence of latent or
 2338:   other defects, accuracy, or the present or absence of errors, whether or not
 2339:   discoverable, all to the greatest extent permissible under applicable law.
 2340: 
 2341:   c. Affirmer disclaims responsibility for clearing rights of other persons
 2342:   that may apply to the Work or any use thereof, including without limitation

 2381: entities that control, are controlled by, or are under common control with
 2382: that entity. For the purposes of this definition, "control" means (i) the
 2383: power, direct or indirect, to cause the direction or management of such
 2384: entity, whether by contract or otherwise, or (ii) ownership of fifty percent
 2385: (50%) or more of the outstanding shares, or (iii) beneficial ownership of such
 2386: entity.
 2387:

 2389: permissions granted by this License.
 2390: 
 2391: "Source" form shall mean the preferred form for making modifications,
 2392: including but not limited to software source code, documentation source, and
 2393: configuration files.
 2394:

 2396: translation of a Source form, including but not limited to compiled object
 2397: code, generated documentation, and conversions to other media types.
 2398:

 2400: made available under the License, as indicated by a copyright notice that is
 2401: included in or attached to the work (an example is provided in the Appendix
 2402: below).

 2405: is based on (or derived from) the Work and for which the editorial revisions,
 2406: annotations, elaborations, or other modifications represent, as a whole, an
 2407: original work of authorship. For the purposes of this License, Derivative
 2408: Works shall not include works that remain separable from, or merely link (or
 2409: bind by name) to the interfaces of, the Work and Derivative Works thereof.

 2573: 
 2574: "Contribution" means:
 2575:      a) in the case of the initial Contributor, the initial code and
 2576:      documentation distributed under this Agreement, and
 2577:      b) in the case of each subsequent Contributor:
 2578:           i) changes to the Program, and
 2579:           ii) additions to the Program;
 2580: 
 2581: where such changes and/or additions to the Program originate from and are
 2582: distributed by that particular Contributor. A Contribution 'originates' from a
 2583: Contributor if it was added to the Program by such Contributor itself or
 2584: anyone acting on such Contributor's behalf. Contributions do not include
 2585: additions to the Program which: (i) are separate modules of software
 2586: distributed in conjunction with the Program under their own license agreement,
 2587: and (ii) are not derivative works of the Program.
 2588: "Contributor" means any person or entity that distributes the Program.
 2589: 
 2590: "Licensed Patents" mean patent claims licensable by a Contributor which are
 2591: necessarily infringed by the use or sale of its Contribution alone or when
 2592: combined with the Program.
 2593: 
 2594: "Program" means the Contributions distributed in accordance with this
 2595: Agreement.
 2596: 
 2597: "Recipient" means anyone who receives the Program under this Agreement,
 2598: including all Contributors.
 2599: 
 2600: 2. GRANT OF RIGHTS
 2601: 
 2602:      a) Subject to the terms of this Agreement, each Contributor hereby grants
 2603:      Recipient a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free copyright license to
 2604:      reproduce, prepare derivative works of, publicly display, publicly
 2605:      perform, distribute and sublicense the Contribution of such Contributor,
 2606:      if any, and such derivative works, in source code and object code form.
 2607: 
 2608:      b) Subject to the terms of this Agreement, each Contributor hereby grants
 2609:      Recipient a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free patent license under
 2610:      Licensed Patents to make, use, sell, offer to sell, import and otherwise
 2611:      transfer the Contribution of such Contributor, if any, in source code and
 2612:      object code form. This patent license shall apply to the combination of
 2613:      the Contribution and the Program if, at the time the Contribution is
 2614:      added by the Contributor, such addition of the Contribution causes such
 2615:      combination to be covered by the Licensed Patents. The patent license
 2616:      shall not apply to any other combinations which include the Contribution.
 2617:      No hardware per se is licensed hereunder.
 2618: 
 2619:      c) Recipient understands that although each Contributor grants the
 2620:      licenses to its Contributions set forth herein, no assurances are
 2621:      provided by any Contributor that the Program does not infringe the patent
 2622:      or other intellectual property rights of any other entity. Each
 2623:      Contributor disclaims any liability to Recipient for claims brought by
 2624:      any other entity based on infringement of intellectual property rights or
 2625:      otherwise. As a condition to exercising the rights and licenses granted
 2626:      hereunder, each Recipient hereby assumes sole responsibility to secure
 2627:      any other intellectual property rights needed, if any. For example, if a
 2628:      third party patent license is required to allow Recipient to distribute
 2629:      the Program, it is Recipient's responsibility to acquire that license
 2630:      before distributing the Program.
 2631: 
 2632:      d) Each Contributor represents that to its knowledge it has sufficient
 2633:      copyright rights in its Contribution, if any, to grant the copyright
 2634:      license set forth in this Agreement.

 2644:           warranties and conditions, express and implied, including warranties
 2645:           or conditions of title and non-infringement, and implied warranties
 2646:           or conditions of merchantability and fitness for a particular
 2647:           purpose;
 2648:           ii) effectively excludes on behalf of all Contributors all liability
 2649:           for damages, including direct, indirect, special, incidental and
 2650:           consequential damages, such as lost profits;
 2651:           iii) states that any provisions which differ from this Agreement are
 2652:           offered by that Contributor alone and not by any other party; and
 2653:           iv) states that source code for the Program is available from such
 2654:           Contributor, and informs licensees how to obtain it in a reasonable
 2655:           manner on or through a medium customarily used for software
 2656:           exchange.

 2659: 
 2660:      a) it must be made available under this Agreement; and
 2661: 
 2662:      b) a copy of this Agreement must be included with each copy of the
 2663:      Program.

 2665: the Program.

 2668: if any, in a manner that reasonably allows subsequent Recipients to identify
 2669: the originator of the Contribution.
 2670: 
 2671: 4. COMMERCIAL DISTRIBUTION
 2672: Commercial distributors of software may accept certain responsibilities with
 2673: respect to end users, business partners and the like. While this license is
 2674: intended to facilitate the commercial use of the Program, the Contributor who
 2675: includes the Program in a commercial product offering should do so in a manner
 2676: which does not create potential liability for other Contributors. Therefore,
 2677: if a Contributor includes the Program in a commercial product offering, such
 2678: Contributor ("Commercial Contributor") hereby agrees to defend and indemnify
 2679: every other Contributor ("Indemnified Contributor") against any losses,
 2680: damages and costs (collectively "Losses") arising from claims, lawsuits and
 2681: other legal actions brought by a third party against the Indemnified
 2682: Contributor to the extent caused by the acts or omissions of such Commercial
 2683: Contributor in connection with its distribution of the Program in a commercial
 2684: product offering. The obligations in this section do not apply to any claims
 2685: or Losses relating to any actual or alleged intellectual property
 2686: infringement. In order to qualify, an Indemnified Contributor must: a)
 2687: promptly notify the Commercial Contributor in writing of such claim, and b)
 2688: allow the Commercial Contributor to control, and cooperate with the Commercial
 2689: Contributor in, the defense and any related settlement negotiations. The
 2690: Indemnified Contributor may participate in any such claim at its own expense.
 2691: 
 2692: For example, a Contributor might include the Program in a commercial product
 2693: offering, Product X. That Contributor is then a Commercial Contributor. If
 2694: that Commercial Contributor then makes performance claims, or offers
 2695: warranties related to Product X, those performance claims and warranties are
 2696: such Commercial Contributor's responsibility alone. Under this section, the
 2697: Commercial Contributor would have to defend claims against the other
 2698: Contributors related to those performance claims and warranties, and if a
 2699: court requires any other Contributor to pay any damages as a result, the
 2700: Commercial Contributor must pay those damages.
 2701: 
 2702: 5. NO WARRANTY
 2703: EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH IN THIS AGREEMENT, THE PROGRAM IS PROVIDED ON AN
 2704: "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR
 2705: IMPLIED INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, ANY WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF TITLE,
 2706: NON-INFRINGEMENT, MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. Each
 2707: Recipient is solely responsible for determining the appropriateness of using
 2708: and distributing the Program and assumes all risks associated with its
 2709: exercise of rights under this Agreement , including but not limited to the
 2710: risks and costs of program errors, compliance with applicable laws, damage to
 2711: or loss of data, programs or equipment, and unavailability or interruption of
 2712: operations.
 2713: 
 2714: 6. DISCLAIMER OF LIABILITY
 2715: EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH IN THIS AGREEMENT, NEITHER RECIPIENT NOR ANY
 2716: CONTRIBUTORS SHALL HAVE ANY LIABILITY FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
 2717: SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION
 2718: LOST PROFITS), HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN
 2719: CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE)
 2720: ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OR DISTRIBUTION OF THE PROGRAM OR THE
 2721: EXERCISE OF ANY RIGHTS GRANTED HEREUNDER, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY
 2722: OF SUCH DAMAGES.

 2724: 7. GENERAL
 2725: 
 2726: If any provision of this Agreement is invalid or unenforceable under
 2727: applicable law, it shall not affect the validity or enforceability of the
 2728: remainder of the terms of this Agreement, and without further action by the
 2729: parties hereto, such provision shall be reformed to the minimum extent
 2730: necessary to make such provision valid and enforceable.
 2731: 
 2732: If Recipient institutes patent litigation against any entity (including a
 2733: cross-claim or counterclaim in a lawsuit) alleging that the Program itself
 2734: (excluding combinations of the Program with other software or hardware)
 2735: infringes such Recipient's patent(s), then such Recipient's rights granted
 2736: under Section 2(b) shall terminate as of the date such litigation is filed.
 2737: 
 2738: All Recipient's rights under this Agreement shall terminate if it fails to
 2739: comply with any of the material terms or conditions of this Agreement and does
 2740: not cure such failure in a reasonable period of time after becoming aware of
 2741: such noncompliance. If all Recipient's rights under this Agreement terminate,
 2742: Recipient agrees to cease use and distribution of the Program as soon as
 2743: reasonably practicable. However, Recipient's obligations under this Agreement
 2744: and any licenses granted by Recipient relating to the Program shall continue
 2745: and survive.
 2746: 
 2747: Everyone is permitted to copy and distribute copies of this Agreement, but in
 2748: order to avoid inconsistency the Agreement is copyrighted and may only be
 2749: modified in the following manner. The Agreement Steward reserves the right to
 2750: publish new versions (including revisions) of this Agreement from time to
 2751: time. No one other than the Agreement Steward has the right to modify this
 2752: Agreement. The Eclipse Foundation is the initial Agreement Steward. The
 2753: Eclipse Foundation may assign the responsibility to serve as the Agreement
 2754: Steward to a suitable separate entity. Each new version of the Agreement will
 2755: be given a distinguishing version number. The Program (including
 2756: Contributions) may always be distributed subject to the version of the
 2757: Agreement under which it was received. In addition, after a new version of the
 2758: Agreement is published, Contributor may elect to distribute the Program
 2759: (including its Contributions) under the new version. Except as expressly
 2760: stated in Sections 2(a) and 2(b) above, Recipient receives no rights or
 2761: licenses to the intellectual property of any Contributor under this Agreement,
 2762: whether expressly, by implication, estoppel or otherwise. All rights in the
 2763: Program not expressly granted under this Agreement are reserved.

 2781: 1. DEFINITIONS
 2782: 
 2783: "Contribution" means:
 2784: 
 2785:   a) in the case of the initial Contributor, the initial content
 2786:      Distributed under this Agreement, and
 2787: 
 2788:   b) in the case of each subsequent Contributor:
 2789:      i) changes to the Program, and
 2790:      ii) additions to the Program;
 2791:   where such changes and/or additions to the Program originate from
 2792:   and are Distributed by that particular Contributor. A Contribution
 2793:   "originates" from a Contributor if it was added to the Program by
 2794:   such Contributor itself or anyone acting on such Contributor's behalf.
 2795:   Contributions do not include changes or additions to the Program that
 2796:   are not Modified Works.
 2797: 
 2798: "Contributor" means any person or entity that Distributes the Program.
 2799: 
 2800: "Licensed Patents" mean patent claims licensable by a Contributor which
 2801: are necessarily infringed by the use or sale of its Contribution alone
 2802: or when combined with the Program.
 2803: 
 2804: "Program" means the Contributions Distributed in accordance with this
 2805: Agreement.
 2806: 
 2807: "Recipient" means anyone who receives the Program under this Agreement
 2808: or any Secondary License (as applicable), including Contributors.
 2809: 
 2810: "Derivative Works" shall mean any work, whether in Source Code or other
 2811: form, that is based on (or derived from) the Program and for which the
 2812: editorial revisions, annotations, elaborations, or other modifications
 2813: represent, as a whole, an original work of authorship.
 2814: 
 2815: "Modified Works" shall mean any work in Source Code or other form that
 2816: results from an addition to, deletion from, or modification of the
 2817: contents of the Program, including, for purposes of clarity any new file
 2818: in Source Code form that contains any contents of the Program. Modified
 2819: Works shall not include works that contain only declarations,
 2820: interfaces, types, classes, structures, or files of the Program solely
 2821: in each case in order to link to, bind by name, or subclass the Program
 2822: or Modified Works thereof.
 2823: 
 2824: "Distribute" means the acts of a) distributing or b) making available
 2825: in any manner that enables the transfer of a copy.
 2826: 
 2827: "Source Code" means the form of a Program preferred for making
 2828: modifications, including but not limited to software source code,
 2829: documentation source, and configuration files.
 2830: 
 2831: "Secondary License" means either the GNU General Public License,
 2832: Version 2.0, or any later versions of that license, including any
 2833: exceptions or additional permissions as identified by the initial
 2834: Contributor.

 2928: 4. COMMERCIAL DISTRIBUTION
 2929: 
 2930: Commercial distributors of software may accept certain responsibilities
 2931: with respect to end users, business partners and the like. While this
 2932: license is intended to facilitate the commercial use of the Program,
 2933: the Contributor who includes the Program in a commercial product
 2934: offering should do so in a manner which does not create potential
 2935: liability for other Contributors. Therefore, if a Contributor includes
 2936: the Program in a commercial product offering, such Contributor
 2937: ("Commercial Contributor") hereby agrees to defend and indemnify every
 2938: other Contributor ("Indemnified Contributor") against any losses,
 2939: damages and costs (collectively "Losses") arising from claims, lawsuits
 2940: and other legal actions brought by a third party against the Indemnified
 2941: Contributor to the extent caused by the acts or omissions of such
 2942: Commercial Contributor in connection with its distribution of the Program
 2943: in a commercial product offering. The obligations in this section do not
 2944: apply to any claims or Losses relating to any actual or alleged
 2945: intellectual property infringement. In order to qualify, an Indemnified
 2946: Contributor must: a) promptly notify the Commercial Contributor in
 2947: writing of such claim, and b) allow the Commercial Contributor to control,
 2948: and cooperate with the Commercial Contributor in, the defense and any
 2949: related settlement negotiations. The Indemnified Contributor may
 2950: participate in any such claim at its own expense.
 2951: 
 2952: For example, a Contributor might include the Program in a commercial
 2953: product offering, Product X. That Contributor is then a Commercial
 2954: Contributor. If that Commercial Contributor then makes performance
 2955: claims, or offers warranties related to Product X, those performance
 2956: claims and warranties are such Commercial Contributor's responsibility
 2957: alone. Under this section, the Commercial Contributor would have to
 2958: defend claims against the other Contributors related to those performance
 2959: claims and warranties, and if a court requires any other Contributor to
 2960: pay any damages as a result, the Commercial Contributor must pay
 2961: those damages.

 3078: 
 3079: In this Licence, the
 3080: following terms have the following meaning:
 3081: 
 3082: - The Licence: this Licence.
 3083: 
 3084: - The Original Work or the Software: the software distributed
 3085: and/or communicated by the Licensor under this Licence, available as Source
 3086: Code and also as Executable Code as the case may be.
 3087: 
 3088: - Derivative Works:
 3089: the works or software that could be created by the Licensee, based upon the
 3090: Original Work or modifications thereof. This Licence does not define the
 3091: extent of modification or dependence on the Original Work required in order to
 3092: classify a work as a Derivative Work; this extent is determined by copyright
 3093: law applicable in the country mentioned in Article 15.
 3094: 
 3095: - The Work: the Original Work and/or its Derivative Works.
 3096: 
 3097: - The Source Code: the human-readable form of the Work which is the most
 3098: convenient for people to study and modify.
 3099: 
 3100: - The Executable Code: any code which has generally been compiled and which
 3101: is meant to be interpreted by a computer as a program.
 3102: 
 3103: - The Licensor: the natural or legal person that distributes and/or
 3104: communicates the Work under the Licence.
 3105: 
 3106: - Contributor(s): any natural or legal person who modifies the Work under the
 3107: Licence, or otherwise contributes to the creation of a Derivative Work.
 3108: 
 3109: - The Licensee or вЂњYouвЂќ: any natural or legal person who makes any usage of
 3110: the Software under the terms of the Licence.

 3113: renting, distributing, communicating, transmitting, or otherwise

 3115: to its essential functionalities at the disposal of any other natural or legal

 3175: all notices that refer to the Licence and to the disclaimer of warranties. The
 3176: Licensee must include a copy of such notices and a copy of the Licence with
 3177: every copy of the Work he/she distributes and/or communicates. The Licensee
 3178: must cause any Derivative Work to carry prominent notices stating that the
 3179: Work has been modified and the date of modification.
 3180:

 3183: or Derivative Works based upon the Original Work, this Distribution and/or
 3184: Communication will be done under the terms of this Licence or of a later
 3185: version of this Licence unless the Original Work is expressly distributed only
 3186: under this version of the Licence. The Licensee (becoming Licensor) cannot
 3187: offer or impose any additional terms or conditions on the Work or Derivative
 3188: Work that alter or restrict the terms of the Licence.
 3189: 
 3190: Compatibility clause:
 3191: If the Licensee Distributes and/or Communicates Derivative Works or copies
 3192: thereof based upon both the Original Work and another work  licensed under a
 3193: Compatible Licence, this Distribution and/or Communication can be done under
 3194: the terms of this Compatible Licence. For the sake of this clause,
 3195: вЂњCompatible LicenceвЂќ refers to the licences listed in the appendix
 3196: attached to this Licence. Should the LicenseeвЂ™s obligations under the
 3197: Compatible Licence conflict with his/her obligations under this Licence, the
 3198: obligations of the Compatible Licence shall prevail.
 3199:

 3201: When distributing and/or communicating copies of the Work, the Licensee
 3202: will provide a machine-readable copy of the Source Code or indicate a
 3203: repository where this Source will be easily and freely available for as long
 3204: as the Licensee continues to distribute and/or communicate the Work.

 3208: trademarks, service marks, or names of the Licensor, except as required for

 3210: reproducing the content of the copyright notice.

 3245: 
 3246: Except in the cases of wilful misconduct or damages directly caused to
 3247: natural persons, the Licensor will in no event be liable for any direct or
 3248: indirect, material or moral, damages of any kind, arising out of the Licence
 3249: or of the use of the Work, including without limitation,
 3250: damages for loss of goodwill, work stoppage, computer failure or malfunction,
 3251: loss of data or any commercial damage, even if the Licensor has been advised
 3252: of the possibility of such damage. However, the Licensor will be liable under
 3253: statutory product liability laws as far such laws apply to the Work.
 3254: 
 3255: 
 3256: 9. Additional agreements
 3257: 
 3258: While distributing the Original Work or Derivative Works, You may choose
 3259: to conclude an additional agreement to offer, and charge a fee for,
 3260: acceptance of support, warranty, indemnity, or other liability
 3261: obligations and/or services consistent with this Licence. However, in
 3262: accepting such obligations, You may act only on your own behalf and on your
 3263: sole responsibility, not on behalf of the original Licensor or any other
 3264: Contributor, and only if You agree to indemnify, defend, and hold each
 3265: Contributor harmless for any liability incurred by, or claims asserted against
 3266: such Contributor by the fact You have accepted any such warranty or additional
 3267: liability.
 3268: 
 3269: 
 3270: 10. Acceptance of the Licence
 3271: 
 3272: The provisions of this Licence can be accepted by clicking on
 3273: an icon вЂњI agreeвЂќ placed under the bottom of a window displaying the text of
 3274: this Licence or by affirming consent in any other similar way, in accordance
 3275: with the rules of applicable law. Clicking on that icon indicates your clear
 3276: and irrevocable acceptance of this Licence and
 3277: all of its terms and conditions.
 3278: 
 3279: Similarly, you irrevocably accept this Licence and
 3280: all of its terms and conditions by exercising any rights granted to You
 3281: by Article 2 of this Licence, such as the use of the Work,
 3282: the creation by You of a Derivative Work or the Distribution and/or
 3283: Communication by You of the Work or copies thereof.
 3284: 
 3285: 
 3286: 11. Information to the public
 3287: 
 3288: In case of any Distribution and/or Communication of the Work by means of
 3289: electronic communication by You (for example, by offering to download
 3290: the Work from a remote location) the distribution channel or media (for
 3291: example, a website) must at least provide to the public the information
 3292: requested by the applicable law regarding the Licensor, the Licence and the
 3293: way it may be accessible, concluded, stored and reproduced by the
 3294: Licensee.
 3295:

 3298: 
 3299: The Licence and the rights granted hereunder will terminate automatically
 3300: upon any breach by the Licensee of the terms of the Licence.
 3301: 
 3302: Such a termination will not terminate the licences of any person who has
 3303: received the Work from the Licensee under the Licence, provided such persons
 3304: remain in full compliance with the Licence.

 3310: agreement between the Parties as to the Work licensed hereunder.

 3313: law, this will not affect the validity or enforceability of the Licence as a
 3314: whole. Such provision will be construed and/or reformed so as necessary
 3315: to make it valid and enforceable.

 3318: versions of this Licence, so far this is required and reasonable, without
 3319: reducing the scope of the rights granted by the Licence.

 3321:

 3323: have identical value. Parties can take advantage of the linguistic version
 3324: of their choice.

 3333: the European Community.
 3334:

 3336: and resulting from the interpretation of this License, will be subject to the
 3337: exclusive jurisdiction of the competent court where the Licensor resides or
 3338: conducts its primary business.

 3374: EUPL В© the European Union 2007, 2016
 3375: 
 3376: This European Union Public Licence (the вЂEUPLвЂ™) applies to the Work (as
 3377: defined below) which is provided under the terms of this Licence. Any use of
 3378: the Work, other than as authorised under this Licence is prohibited (to the
 3379: extent such use is covered by a right of the copyright holder of the Work).
 3380: 
 3381: The Work is provided under the terms of this Licence when the Licensor (as
 3382: defined below) has placed the following notice immediately following the
 3383: copyright notice for the Work: вЂњLicensed under the EUPLвЂќ, or has expressed by
 3384: any other means his willingness to license under the EUPL.
 3385: 
 3386: 1. Definitions
 3387: 
 3388: In this Licence, the following terms have the following meaning:
 3389: вЂ” вЂThe LicenceвЂ™: this Licence.
 3390: вЂ” вЂThe Original WorkвЂ™: the work or software distributed or communicated by the
 3391:   вЂLicensor under this Licence, available as Source Code and also as
 3392:   вЂExecutable Code as the case may be.
 3393: вЂ” вЂDerivative WorksвЂ™: the works or software that could be created by the
 3394:   вЂLicensee, based upon the Original Work or modifications thereof. This
 3395:   вЂLicence does not define the extent of modification or dependence on the
 3396:   вЂOriginal Work required in order to classify a work as a Derivative Work;
 3397:   вЂthis extent is determined by copyright law applicable in the country
 3398:   вЂmentioned in Article 15.
 3399: вЂ” вЂThe WorkвЂ™: the Original Work or its Derivative Works.
 3400: вЂ” вЂThe Source CodeвЂ™: the human-readable form of the Work which is the most
 3401:   convenient for people to study and modify.
 3402: 
 3403: вЂ” вЂThe Executable CodeвЂ™: any code which has generally been compiled and which
 3404:   is meant to be interpreted by a computer as a program.
 3405: вЂ” вЂThe LicensorвЂ™: the natural or legal person that distributes or communicates
 3406:   the Work under the Licence.
 3407: вЂ” вЂContributor(s)вЂ™: any natural or legal person who modifies the Work under
 3408:   the Licence, or otherwise contributes to the creation of a Derivative Work.
 3409: вЂ” вЂThe LicenseeвЂ™ or вЂYouвЂ™: any natural or legal person who makes any usage of
 3410:   the Work under the terms of the Licence.
 3411: вЂ” вЂDistributionвЂ™ or вЂCommunicationвЂ™: any act of selling, giving, lending,
 3412:   renting, distributing, communicating, transmitting, or otherwise making
 3413:   available, online or offline, copies of the Work or providing access to its
 3414:   essential functionalities at the disposal of any other natural or legal
 3415:   person.
 3416:

 3421: vested in the Original Work:

 3425: вЂ” modify the Work, and make Derivative Works based upon the Work,
 3426: вЂ” communicate to the public, including the right to make available or display
 3427:   the Work or copies thereof to the public and perform publicly, as the case
 3428:   may be, the Work,
 3429: вЂ” distribute the Work or copies thereof,
 3430: вЂ” lend and rent the Work or copies thereof,
 3431: вЂ” sublicense rights in the Work or copies thereof.
 3432:

 3434: known or later invented, as far as the applicable law permits so.

 3437: exercise his moral right to the extent allowed by law in order to make
 3438: effective the licence of the economic rights here above listed.

 3441: to any patents held by the Licensor, to the extent necessary to make use of
 3442: the rights granted on the Work under this Licence.

 3447: Executable Code. If the Work is provided as Executable Code, the Licensor

 3452: Licensor continues to distribute or communicate the Work.

 3464: obligations imposed on the Licensee. Those obligations are the following:
 3465:

 3467: trademarks notices and all notices that refer to the Licence and to the
 3468: disclaimer of warranties. The Licensee must include a copy of such notices and
 3469: a copy of the Licence with every copy of the Work he/she distributes or
 3470: communicates. The Licensee must cause any Derivative Work to carry prominent
 3471: notices stating that the Work has been modified and the date of modification.
 3472:

 3474: Original Works or Derivative Works, this Distribution or Communication will be
 3475: done under the terms of this Licence or of a later version of this Licence
 3476: unless the Original Work is expressly distributed only under this version of
 3477: the Licence вЂ” for example by communicating вЂEUPL v. 1.2 onlyвЂ™. The Licensee
 3478: (becoming Licensor) cannot offer or impose any additional terms or conditions
 3479: on the Work or Derivative Work that alter or restrict the terms of the
 3480: Licence.
 3481: 
 3482: Compatibility clause: If the Licensee Distributes or Communicates Derivative
 3483: Works or copies thereof based upon both the Work and another work licensed
 3484: under a Compatible Licence, this Distribution or Communication can be done
 3485: under the terms of this Compatible Licence. For the sake of this clause,
 3486: вЂCompatible LicenceвЂ™ refers to the licences listed in the appendix attached to
 3487: this Licence. Should the Licensee's obligations under the Compatible Licence
 3488: conflict with his/her obligations under this Licence, the obligations of the
 3489: Compatible Licence shall prevail.
 3490: 
 3491: Provision of Source Code: When distributing or communicating copies of the
 3492: Work, the Licensee will provide a machine-readable copy of the Source Code or
 3493: indicate a repository where this Source will be easily and freely available
 3494: for as long as the Licensee continues to distribute or communicate the Work.
 3495:

 3497: names, trademarks, service marks, or names of the Licensor, except as required

 3657: 
 3658:                             Preamble
 3659: 
 3660:   The licenses for most software are designed to take away your
 3661: freedom to share and change it.  By contrast, the GNU General Public
 3662: License is intended to guarantee your freedom to share and change free
 3663: software--to make sure the software is free for all its users.  This
 3664: General Public License applies to most of the Free Software
 3665: Foundation's software and to any other program whose authors commit to
 3666: using it.  (Some other Free Software Foundation software is covered by
 3667: the GNU Lesser General Public License instead.)  You can apply it to
 3668: your programs, too.
 3669: 
 3670:   When we speak of free software, we are referring to freedom, not
 3671: price.  Our General Public Licenses are designed to make sure that you
 3672: have the freedom to distribute copies of free software (and charge for
 3673: this service if you wish), that you receive source code or can get it
 3674: if you want it, that you can change the software or use pieces of it
 3675: in new free programs; and that you know you can do these things.
 3676: 
 3677:   To protect your rights, we need to make restrictions that forbid
 3678: anyone to deny you these rights or to ask you to surrender the rights.
 3679: These restrictions translate to certain responsibilities for you if you
 3680: distribute copies of the software, or if you modify it.
 3681: 
 3682:   For example, if you distribute copies of such a program, whether
 3683: gratis or for a fee, you must give the recipients all the rights that
 3684: you have.  You must make sure that they, too, receive or can get the
 3685: source code.  And you must show them these terms so they know their
 3686: rights.
 3687: 
 3688:   We protect your rights with two steps: (1) copyright the software, and
 3689: (2) offer you this license which gives you legal permission to copy,
 3690: distribute and/or modify the software.
 3691: 
 3692:   Also, for each author's protection and ours, we want to make certain
 3693: that everyone understands that there is no warranty for this free
 3694: software.  If the software is modified by someone else and passed on, we
 3695: want its recipients to know that what they have is not the original, so
 3696: that any problems introduced by others will not reflect on the original
 3697: authors' reputations.
 3698: 
 3699:   Finally, any free program is threatened constantly by software
 3700: patents.  We wish to avoid the danger that redistributors of a free
 3701: program will individually obtain patent licenses, in effect making the
 3702: program proprietary.  To prevent this, we have made it clear that any
 3703: patent must be licensed for everyone's free use or not licensed at all.
 3704: 
 3705:   The precise terms and conditions for copying, distribution and
 3706: modification follow.
 3707: 
 3708:                     GNU GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE
 3709:    TERMS AND CONDITIONS FOR COPYING, DISTRIBUTION AND MODIFICATION
 3710: 
 3711:   0. This License applies to any program or other work which contains
 3712: a notice placed by the copyright holder saying it may be distributed
 3713: under the terms of this General Public License.  The "Program", below,
 3714: refers to any such program or work, and a "work based on the Program"
 3715: means either the Program or any derivative work under copyright law:
 3716: that is to say, a work containing the Program or a portion of it,
 3717: either verbatim or with modifications and/or translated into another
 3718: language.  (Hereinafter, translation is included without limitation in
 3719: the term "modification".)  Each licensee is addressed as "you".
 3720: 
 3721: Activities other than copying, distribution and modification are not
 3722: covered by this License; they are outside its scope.  The act of
 3723: running the Program is not restricted, and the output from the Program
 3724: is covered only if its contents constitute a work based on the
 3725: Program (independent of having been made by running the Program).
 3726: Whether that is true depends on what the Program does.
 3727: 
 3728:   1. You may copy and distribute verbatim copies of the Program's
 3729: source code as you receive it, in any medium, provided that you
 3730: conspicuously and appropriately publish on each copy an appropriate
 3731: copyright notice and disclaimer of warranty; keep intact all the
 3732: notices that refer to this License and to the absence of any warranty;
 3733: and give any other recipients of the Program a copy of this License
 3734: along with the Program.
 3735: 
 3736: You may charge a fee for the physical act of transferring a copy, and
 3737: you may at your option offer warranty protection in exchange for a fee.
 3738: 
 3739:   2. You may modify your copy or copies of the Program or any portion
 3740: of it, thus forming a work based on the Program, and copy and
 3741: distribute such modifications or work under the terms of Section 1
 3742: above, provided that you also meet all of these conditions:
 3743: 
 3744:     a) You must cause the modified files to carry prominent notices
 3745:     stating that you changed the files and the date of any change.
 3746: 
 3747:     b) You must cause any work that you distribute or publish, that in
 3748:     whole or in part contains or is derived from the Program or any
 3749:     part thereof, to be licensed as a whole at no charge to all third
 3750:     parties under the terms of this License.
 3751: 
 3752:     c) If the modified program normally reads commands interactively
 3753:     when run, you must cause it, when started running for such
 3754:     interactive use in the most ordinary way, to print or display an
 3755:     announcement including an appropriate copyright notice and a
 3756:     notice that there is no warranty (or else, saying that you provide
 3757:     a warranty) and that users may redistribute the program under
 3758:     these conditions, and telling the user how to view a copy of this
 3759:     License.  (Exception: if the Program itself is interactive but
 3760:     does not normally print such an announcement, your work based on
 3761:     the Program is not required to print an announcement.)
 3762: 
 3763: These requirements apply to the modified work as a whole.  If
 3764: identifiable sections of that work are not derived from the Program,
 3765: and can be reasonably considered independent and separate works in
 3766: themselves, then this License, and its terms, do not apply to those
 3767: sections when you distribute them as separate works.  But when you
 3768: distribute the same sections as part of a whole which is a work based
 3769: on the Program, the distribution of the whole must be on the terms of
 3770: this License, whose permissions for other licensees extend to the
 3771: entire whole, and thus to each and every part regardless of who wrote it.
 3772: 
 3773: Thus, it is not the intent of this section to claim rights or contest
 3774: your rights to work written entirely by you; rather, the intent is to
 3775: exercise the right to control the distribution of derivative or
 3776: collective works based on the Program.
 3777: 
 3778: In addition, mere aggregation of another work not based on the Program
 3779: with the Program (or with a work based on the Program) on a volume of
 3780: a storage or distribution medium does not bring the other work under
 3781: the scope of this License.
 3782: 
 3783:   3. You may copy and distribute the Program (or a work based on it,
 3784: under Section 2) in object code or executable form under the terms of
 3785: Sections 1 and 2 above provided that you also do one of the following:
 3786: 
 3787:     a) Accompany it with the complete corresponding machine-readable
 3788:     source code, which must be distributed under the terms of Sections
 3789:     1 and 2 above on a medium customarily used for software interchange; or,
 3790: 
 3791:     b) Accompany it with a written offer, valid for at least three
 3792:     years, to give any third party, for a charge no more than your
 3793:     cost of physically performing source distribution, a complete
 3794:     machine-readable copy of the corresponding source code, to be
 3795:     distributed under the terms of Sections 1 and 2 above on a medium
 3796:     customarily used for software interchange; or,
 3797: 
 3798:     c) Accompany it with the information you received as to the offer
 3799:     to distribute corresponding source code.  (This alternative is
 3800:     allowed only for noncommercial distribution and only if you
 3801:     received the program in object code or executable form with such
 3802:     an offer, in accord with Subsection b above.)
 3803: 
 3804: The source code for a work means the preferred form of the work for
 3805: making modifications to it.  For an executable work, complete source
 3806: code means all the source code for all modules it contains, plus any
 3807: associated interface definition files, plus the scripts used to
 3808: control compilation and installation of the executable.  However, as a
 3809: special exception, the source code distributed need not include
 3810: anything that is normally distributed (in either source or binary
 3811: form) with the major components (compiler, kernel, and so on) of the
 3812: operating system on which the executable runs, unless that component
 3813: itself accompanies the executable.
 3814: 
 3815: If distribution of executable or object code is made by offering
 3816: access to copy from a designated place, then offering equivalent
 3817: access to copy the source code from the same place counts as
 3818: distribution of the source code, even though third parties are not
 3819: compelled to copy the source along with the object code.
 3820: 
 3821:   4. You may not copy, modify, sublicense, or distribute the Program
 3822: except as expressly provided under this License.  Any attempt
 3823: otherwise to copy, modify, sublicense or distribute the Program is
 3824: void, and will automatically terminate your rights under this License.
 3825: However, parties who have received copies, or rights, from you under
 3826: this License will not have their licenses terminated so long as such
 3827: parties remain in full compliance.
 3828: 
 3829:   5. You are not required to accept this License, since you have not
 3830: signed it.  However, nothing else grants you permission to modify or
 3831: distribute the Program or its derivative works.  These actions are
 3832: prohibited by law if you do not accept this License.  Therefore, by
 3833: modifying or distributing the Program (or any work based on the
 3834: Program), you indicate your acceptance of this License to do so, and
 3835: all its terms and conditions for copying, distributing or modifying
 3836: the Program or works based on it.

 3838:   6. Each time you redistribute the Program (or any work based on the
 3839: Program), the recipient automatically receives a license from the
 3840: original licensor to copy, distribute or modify the Program subject to
 3841: these terms and conditions.  You may not impose any further
 3842: restrictions on the recipients' exercise of the rights granted herein.
 3843: You are not responsible for enforcing compliance by third parties to
 3844: this License.
 3845: 
 3846:   7. If, as a consequence of a court judgment or allegation of patent
 3847: infringement or for any other reason (not limited to patent issues),
 3848: conditions are imposed on you (whether by court order, agreement or
 3849: otherwise) that contradict the conditions of this License, they do not
 3850: excuse you from the conditions of this License.  If you cannot
 3851: distribute so as to satisfy simultaneously your obligations under this
 3852: License and any other pertinent obligations, then as a consequence you
 3853: may not distribute the Program at all.  For example, if a patent
 3854: license would not permit royalty-free redistribution of the Program by
 3855: all those who receive copies directly or indirectly through you, then
 3856: the only way you could satisfy both it and this License would be to
 3857: refrain entirely from distribution of the Program.

 3859: If any portion of this section is held invalid or unenforceable under
 3860: any particular circumstance, the balance of the section is intended to
 3861: apply and the section as a whole is intended to apply in other
 3862: circumstances.
 3863: 
 3864: It is not the purpose of this section to induce you to infringe any
 3865: patents or other property right claims or to contest validity of any
 3866: such claims; this section has the sole purpose of protecting the

 3868: implemented by public license practices.  Many people have made
 3869: generous contributions to the wide range of software distributed
 3870: through that system in reliance on consistent application of that
 3871: system; it is up to the author/donor to decide if he or she is willing
 3872: to distribute software through any other system and a licensee cannot
 3873: impose that choice.

 3876: be a consequence of the rest of this License.

 3962: when it starts in an interactive mode:

 3965:     Gnomovision comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY; for details type `show w'.
 3966:     This is free software, and you are welcome to redistribute it
 3967:     under certain conditions; type `show c' for details.
 3968: 
 3969: The hypothetical commands `show w' and `show c' should show the appropriate
 3970: parts of the General Public License.  Of course, the commands you use may
 3971: be called something other than `show w' and `show c'; they could even be
 3972: mouse-clicks or menu items--whatever suits your program.

 3976: necessary.  Here is a sample; alter the names:
