 5210:   This version of the GNU Lesser General Public License incorporates
 5211: the terms and conditions of version 3 of the GNU General Public
 5212: License, supplemented by the additional permissions listed below.
 5213: 
 5214:   0. Additional Definitions.
 5215: 
 5216:   As used herein, "this License" refers to version 3 of the GNU Lesser
 5217: General Public License, and the "GNU GPL" refers to version 3 of the GNU
 5218: General Public License.
 5219: 
 5220:   "The Library" refers to a covered work governed by this License,
 5221: other than an Application or a Combined Work as defined below.
 5222: 
 5223:   An "Application" is any work that makes use of an interface provided
 5224: by the Library, but which is not otherwise based on the Library.
 5225: Defining a subclass of a class defined by the Library is deemed a mode
 5226: of using an interface provided by the Library.
 5227: 
 5228:   A "Combined Work" is a work produced by combining or linking an
 5229: Application with the Library.  The particular version of the Library
 5230: with which the Combined Work was made is also called the "Linked
 5231: Version".
 5232: 
 5233:   The "Minimal Corresponding Source" for a Combined Work means the
 5234: Corresponding Source for the Combined Work, excluding any source code
 5235: for portions of the Combined Work that, considered in isolation, are
 5236: based on the Application, and not on the Linked Version.
 5237: 
 5238:   The "Corresponding Application Code" for a Combined Work means the
 5239: object code and/or source code for the Application, including any data
 5240: and utility programs needed for reproducing the Combined Work from the
 5241: Application, but excluding the System Libraries of the Combined Work.
 5242: 
 5243:   1. Exception to Section 3 of the GNU GPL.
 5244: 
 5245:   You may convey a covered work under sections 3 and 4 of this License
 5246: without being bound by section 3 of the GNU GPL.
 5247: 
 5248:   2. Conveying Modified Versions.
 5249: 
 5250:   If you modify a copy of the Library, and, in your modifications, a
 5251: facility refers to a function or data to be supplied by an Application
 5252: that uses the facility (other than as an argument passed when the
 5253: facility is invoked), then you may convey a copy of the modified
 5254: version:
 5255: 
 5256:    a) under this License, provided that you make a good faith effort to
 5257:    ensure that, in the event an Application does not supply the
 5258:    function or data, the facility still operates, and performs
 5259:    whatever part of its purpose remains meaningful, or
 5260: 
 5261:    b) under the GNU GPL, with none of the additional permissions of
 5262:    this License applicable to that copy.
 5263: 
 5264:   3. Object Code Incorporating Material from Library Header Files.
 5265: 
 5266:   The object code form of an Application may incorporate material from
 5267: a header file that is part of the Library.  You may convey such object
 5268: code under terms of your choice, provided that, if the incorporated
 5269: material is not limited to numerical parameters, data structure
 5270: layouts and accessors, or small macros, inline functions and templates
 5271: (ten or fewer lines in length), you do both of the following:
 5272: 
 5273:    a) Give prominent notice with each copy of the object code that the
 5274:    Library is used in it and that the Library and its use are
 5275:    covered by this License.
 5276: 
 5277:    b) Accompany the object code with a copy of the GNU GPL and this license
 5278:    document.
 5279: 
 5280:   4. Combined Works.
 5281: 
 5282:   You may convey a Combined Work under terms of your choice that,
 5283: taken together, effectively do not restrict modification of the
 5284: portions of the Library contained in the Combined Work and reverse
 5285: engineering for debugging such modifications, if you also do each of
 5286: the following:
 5287: 
 5288:    a) Give prominent notice with each copy of the Combined Work that
 5289:    the Library is used in it and that the Library and its use are
 5290:    covered by this License.
 5291: 
 5292:    b) Accompany the Combined Work with a copy of the GNU GPL and this license
 5293:    document.
 5294: 
 5295:    c) For a Combined Work that displays copyright notices during
 5296:    execution, include the copyright notice for the Library among
 5297:    these notices, as well as a reference directing the user to the
 5298:    copies of the GNU GPL and this license document.
 5299: 
 5300:    d) Do one of the following:
 5301: 
 5302:        0) Convey the Minimal Corresponding Source under the terms of this
 5303:        License, and the Corresponding Application Code in a form
 5304:        suitable for, and under terms that permit, the user to
 5305:        recombine or relink the Application with a modified version of
 5306:        the Linked Version to produce a modified Combined Work, in the
 5307:        manner specified by section 6 of the GNU GPL for conveying
 5308:        Corresponding Source.
 5309: 
 5310:        1) Use a suitable shared library mechanism for linking with the
 5311:        Library.  A suitable mechanism is one that (a) uses at run time
 5312:        a copy of the Library already present on the user's computer
 5313:        system, and (b) will operate properly with a modified version
 5314:        of the Library that is interface-compatible with the Linked
 5315:        Version.
 5316: 
 5317:    e) Provide Installation Information, but only if you would otherwise
 5318:    be required to provide such information under section 6 of the
 5319:    GNU GPL, and only to the extent that such information is
 5320:    necessary to install and execute a modified version of the
 5321:    Combined Work produced by recombining or relinking the
 5322:    Application with a modified version of the Linked Version. (If
 5323:    you use option 4d0, the Installation Information must accompany
 5324:    the Minimal Corresponding Source and Corresponding Application
 5325:    Code. If you use option 4d1, you must provide the Installation
 5326:    Information in the manner specified by section 6 of the GNU GPL
 5327:    for conveying Corresponding Source.)
 5328: 
 5329:   5. Combined Libraries.
 5330: 
 5331:   You may place library facilities that are a work based on the
 5332: Library side by side in a single library together with other library
 5333: facilities that are not Applications and are not covered by this
 5334: License, and convey such a combined library under terms of your
 5335: choice, if you do both of the following:
 5336: 
 5337:    a) Accompany the combined library with a copy of the same work based
 5338:    on the Library, uncombined with any other library facilities,
 5339:    conveyed under the terms of this License.
 5340: 
 5341:    b) Give prominent notice with the combined library that part of it
 5342:    is a work based on the Library, and explaining where to find the
 5343:    accompanying uncombined form of the same work.
 5344: 
 5345:   6. Revised Versions of the GNU Lesser General Public License.
 5346: 
 5347:   The Free Software Foundation may publish revised and/or new versions
 5348: of the GNU Lesser General Public License from time to time. Such new
 5349: versions will be similar in spirit to the present version, but may
 5350: differ in detail to address new problems or concerns.
 5351: 
 5352:   Each version is given a distinguishing version number. If the
 5353: Library as you received it specifies that a certain numbered version
 5354: of the GNU Lesser General Public License "or any later version"
 5355: applies to it, you have the option of following the terms and
 5356: conditions either of that published version or of any later version
 5357: published by the Free Software Foundation. If the Library as you
 5358: received it does not specify a version number of the GNU Lesser
 5359: General Public License, you may choose any version of the GNU Lesser
 5360: General Public License ever published by the Free Software Foundation.
 5361: 
 5362:   If the Library as you received it specifies that a proxy can decide
 5363: whether future versions of the GNU Lesser General Public License shall
 5364: apply, that proxy's public statement of acceptance of any version is
 5365: permanent authorization for you to choose that version for the
 5366: Library.
 5367: ''',
 5368:     ),
 5369:     (
 5370:         'LPPL-1.3c',
 5371:         '''\
 5372: The LaTeX Project Public License
 5373: =-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-
 5374: 
 5375: LPPL Version 1.3c  2008-05-04
 5376: 
 5377: Copyright 1999 2002-2008 LaTeX3 Project
 5378:     Everyone is allowed to distribute verbatim copies of this
 5379:     license document, but modification of it is not allowed.
 5380: 
 5381: 
 5382: PREAMBLE
 5383: ========
 5384: 
 5385: The LaTeX Project Public License (LPPL) is the primary license under
 5386: which the LaTeX kernel and the base LaTeX packages are distributed.
 5387: 
 5388: You may use this license for any work of which you hold the copyright
 5389: and which you wish to distribute.  This license may be particularly
 5390: suitable if your work is TeX-related (such as a LaTeX package), but
 5391: it is written in such a way that you can use it even if your work is
 5392: unrelated to TeX.
 5393: 
 5394: The section `WHETHER AND HOW TO DISTRIBUTE WORKS UNDER THIS LICENSE',
 5395: below, gives instructions, examples, and recommendations for authors
 5396: who are considering distributing their works under this license.
 5397: 
 5398: This license gives conditions under which a work may be distributed
 5399: and modified, as well as conditions under which modified versions of
 5400: that work may be distributed.
 5401: 
 5402: We, the LaTeX3 Project, believe that the conditions below give you
 5403: the freedom to make and distribute modified versions of your work
 5404: that conform with whatever technical specifications you wish while
 5405: maintaining the availability, integrity, and reliability of
 5406: that work.  If you do not see how to achieve your goal while
 5407: meeting these conditions, then read the document `cfgguide.tex'
 5408: and `modguide.tex' in the base LaTeX distribution for suggestions.
 5409: 
 5410: 
 5411: DEFINITIONS
 5412: ===========
 5413: 
 5414: In this license document the following terms are used:
 5415: 
 5416:    `Work'
 5417:     Any work being distributed under this License.
 5418: 
 5419:    `Derived Work'
 5420:     Any work that under any applicable law is derived from the Work.
 5421: 
 5422:    `Modification'
 5423:     Any procedure that produces a Derived Work under any applicable
 5424:     law -- for example, the production of a file containing an
 5425:     original file associated with the Work or a significant portion of
 5426:     such a file, either verbatim or with modifications and/or
 5427:     translated into another language.
 5428: 
 5429:    `Modify'
 5430:     To apply any procedure that produces a Derived Work under any
 5431:     applicable law.
 5432: 
 5433:    `Distribution'
 5434:     Making copies of the Work available from one person to another, in
 5435:     whole or in part.  Distribution includes (but is not limited to)
 5436:     making any electronic components of the Work accessible by
 5437:     file transfer protocols such as FTP or HTTP or by shared file
 5438:     systems such as Sun's Network File System (NFS).
 5439: 
 5440:    `Compiled Work'
 5441:     A version of the Work that has been processed into a form where it
 5442:     is directly usable on a computer system.  This processing may
 5443:     include using installation facilities provided by the Work,
 5444:     transformations of the Work, copying of components of the Work, or
 5445:     other activities.  Note that modification of any installation
 5446:     facilities provided by the Work constitutes modification of the Work.
 5447: 
 5448:    `Current Maintainer'
 5449:     A person or persons nominated as such within the Work.  If there is
 5450:     no such explicit nomination then it is the `Copyright Holder' under
 5451:     any applicable law.
 5452: 
 5453:    `Base Interpreter'
 5454:     A program or process that is normally needed for running or
 5455:     interpreting a part or the whole of the Work.
 5456: 
 5457:     A Base Interpreter may depend on external components but these
 5458:     are not considered part of the Base Interpreter provided that each
 5459:     external component clearly identifies itself whenever it is used
 5460:     interactively.  Unless explicitly specified when applying the
 5461:     license to the Work, the only applicable Base Interpreter is a
 5462:     `LaTeX-Format' or in the case of files belonging to the
 5463:     `LaTeX-format' a program implementing the `TeX language'.
 5464: 
 5465: 
 5466: 
 5467: CONDITIONS ON DISTRIBUTION AND MODIFICATION
 5468: ===========================================
 5469: 
 5470: 1.  Activities other than distribution and/or modification of the Work
 5471: are not covered by this license; they are outside its scope.  In
 5472: particular, the act of running the Work is not restricted and no
 5473: requirements are made concerning any offers of support for the Work.
 5474: 
 5475: 2.  You may distribute a complete, unmodified copy of the Work as you
 5476: received it.  Distribution of only part of the Work is considered
 5477: modification of the Work, and no right to distribute such a Derived
 5478: Work may be assumed under the terms of this clause.
 5479: 
 5480: 3.  You may distribute a Compiled Work that has been generated from a
 5481: complete, unmodified copy of the Work as distributed under Clause 2
 5482: above, as long as that Compiled Work is distributed in such a way that
 5483: the recipients may install the Compiled Work on their system exactly
 5484: as it would have been installed if they generated a Compiled Work
 5485: directly from the Work.
 5486: 
 5487: 4.  If you are the Current Maintainer of the Work, you may, without
 5488: restriction, modify the Work, thus creating a Derived Work.  You may
 5489: also distribute the Derived Work without restriction, including
 5490: Compiled Works generated from the Derived Work.  Derived Works
 5491: distributed in this manner by the Current Maintainer are considered to
 5492: be updated versions of the Work.
 5493: 
 5494: 5.  If you are not the Current Maintainer of the Work, you may modify
 5495: your copy of the Work, thus creating a Derived Work based on the Work,
 5496: and compile this Derived Work, thus creating a Compiled Work based on
 5497: the Derived Work.
 5498: 
 5499: 6.  If you are not the Current Maintainer of the Work, you may
 5500: distribute a Derived Work provided the following conditions are met
 5501: for every component of the Work unless that component clearly states
 5502: in the copyright notice that it is exempt from that condition.  Only
 5503: the Current Maintainer is allowed to add such statements of exemption
 5504: to a component of the Work.
 5505: 
 5506:   a. If a component of this Derived Work can be a direct replacement
 5507:      for a component of the Work when that component is used with the
 5508:      Base Interpreter, then, wherever this component of the Work
 5509:      identifies itself to the user when used interactively with that
 5510:      Base Interpreter, the replacement component of this Derived Work
 5511:      clearly and unambiguously identifies itself as a modified version
 5512:      of this component to the user when used interactively with that
 5513:      Base Interpreter.
 5514: 
 5515:   b. Every component of the Derived Work contains prominent notices
 5516:      detailing the nature of the changes to that component, or a
 5517:      prominent reference to another file that is distributed as part
 5518:      of the Derived Work and that contains a complete and accurate log
 5519:      of the changes.
 5520: 
 5521:   c. No information in the Derived Work implies that any persons,
 5522:      including (but not limited to) the authors of the original version
 5523:      of the Work, provide any support, including (but not limited to)
 5524:      the reporting and handling of errors, to recipients of the
 5525:      Derived Work unless those persons have stated explicitly that
 5526:      they do provide such support for the Derived Work.
 5527: 
 5528:   d. You distribute at least one of the following with the Derived Work:
 5529: 
 5530:        1. A complete, unmodified copy of the Work;
 5531:           if your distribution of a modified component is made by
 5532:           offering access to copy the modified component from a
 5533:           designated place, then offering equivalent access to copy
 5534:           the Work from the same or some similar place meets this
 5535:           condition, even though third parties are not compelled to
 5536:           copy the Work along with the modified component;
 5537: 
 5538:        2. Information that is sufficient to obtain a complete,
 5539:           unmodified copy of the Work.
 5540: 
 5541: 7.  If you are not the Current Maintainer of the Work, you may
 5542: distribute a Compiled Work generated from a Derived Work, as long as
 5543: the Derived Work is distributed to all recipients of the Compiled
 5544: Work, and as long as the conditions of Clause 6, above, are met with
 5545: regard to the Derived Work.
 5546: 
 5547: 8.  The conditions above are not intended to prohibit, and hence do not
 5548: apply to, the modification, by any method, of any component so that it
 5549: becomes identical to an updated version of that component of the Work as
 5550: it is distributed by the Current Maintainer under Clause 4, above.
 5551: 
 5552: 9.  Distribution of the Work or any Derived Work in an alternative
 5553: format, where the Work or that Derived Work (in whole or in part) is
 5554: then produced by applying some process to that format, does not relax or
 5555: nullify any sections of this license as they pertain to the results of
 5556: applying that process.
 5557: 
 5558: 10. a. A Derived Work may be distributed under a different license
 5559:        provided that license itself honors the conditions listed in
 5560:        Clause 6 above, in regard to the Work, though it does not have
 5561:        to honor the rest of the conditions in this license.
 5562: 
 5563:     b. If a Derived Work is distributed under a different license, that
 5564:        Derived Work must provide sufficient documentation as part of
 5565:        itself to allow each recipient of that Derived Work to honor the
 5566:        restrictions in Clause 6 above, concerning changes from the Work.
 5567: 
 5568: 11. This license places no restrictions on works that are unrelated to
 5569: the Work, nor does this license place any restrictions on aggregating
 5570: such works with the Work by any means.
 5571: 
 5572: 12.  Nothing in this license is intended to, or may be used to, prevent
 5573: complete compliance by all parties with all applicable laws.
 5574: 
 5575: 
 5576: NO WARRANTY
 5577: ===========
 5578: 
 5579: There is no warranty for the Work.  Except when otherwise stated in
 5580: writing, the Copyright Holder provides the Work `as is', without
 5581: warranty of any kind, either expressed or implied, including, but not
 5582: limited to, the implied warranties of merchantability and fitness for a
 5583: particular purpose.  The entire risk as to the quality and performance
 5584: of the Work is with you.  Should the Work prove defective, you assume
 5585: the cost of all necessary servicing, repair, or correction.
 5586: 
 5587: In no event unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing
 5588: will The Copyright Holder, or any author named in the components of the
 5589: Work, or any other party who may distribute and/or modify the Work as
 5590: permitted above, be liable to you for damages, including any general,
 5591: special, incidental or consequential damages arising out of any use of
 5592: the Work or out of inability to use the Work (including, but not limited
 5593: to, loss of data, data being rendered inaccurate, or losses sustained by
 5594: anyone as a result of any failure of the Work to operate with any other
 5595: programs), even if the Copyright Holder or said author or said other
 5596: party has been advised of the possibility of such damages.
 5597: 
 5598: 
 5599: MAINTENANCE OF THE WORK
 5600: =======================
 5601: 
 5602: The Work has the status `author-maintained' if the Copyright Holder
 5603: explicitly and prominently states near the primary copyright notice in
 5604: the Work that the Work can only be maintained by the Copyright Holder
 5605: or simply that it is `author-maintained'.
 5606: 
 5607: The Work has the status `maintained' if there is a Current Maintainer
 5608: who has indicated in the Work that they are willing to receive error
 5609: reports for the Work (for example, by supplying a valid e-mail
 5610: address). It is not required for the Current Maintainer to acknowledge
 5611: or act upon these error reports.
 5612: 
 5613: The Work changes from status `maintained' to `unmaintained' if there
 5614: is no Current Maintainer, or the person stated to be Current
 5615: Maintainer of the work cannot be reached through the indicated means
 5616: of communication for a period of six months, and there are no other
 5617: significant signs of active maintenance.
 5618: 
 5619: You can become the Current Maintainer of the Work by agreement with
 5620: any existing Current Maintainer to take over this role.
 5621: 
 5622: If the Work is unmaintained, you can become the Current Maintainer of
 5623: the Work through the following steps:
 5624: 
 5625:  1.  Make a reasonable attempt to trace the Current Maintainer (and
 5626:      the Copyright Holder, if the two differ) through the means of
 5627:      an Internet or similar search.
 5628: 
 5629:  2.  If this search is successful, then enquire whether the Work
 5630:      is still maintained.
 5631: 
 5632:   a. If it is being maintained, then ask the Current Maintainer
 5633:      to update their communication data within one month.
 5634: 
 5635:   b. If the search is unsuccessful or no action to resume active
 5636:      maintenance is taken by the Current Maintainer, then announce
 5637:      within the pertinent community your intention to take over
 5638:      maintenance.  (If the Work is a LaTeX work, this could be
 5639:      done, for example, by posting to comp.text.tex.)
 5640: 
 5641:  3a. If the Current Maintainer is reachable and agrees to pass
 5642:      maintenance of the Work to you, then this takes effect
 5643:      immediately upon announcement.
 5644: 
 5645:   b. If the Current Maintainer is not reachable and the Copyright
 5646:      Holder agrees that maintenance of the Work be passed to you,
 5647:      then this takes effect immediately upon announcement.
 5648: 
 5649:  4.  If you make an `intention announcement' as described in 2b. above
 5650:      and after three months your intention is challenged neither by
 5651:      the Current Maintainer nor by the Copyright Holder nor by other
 5652:      people, then you may arrange for the Work to be changed so as
 5653:      to name you as the (new) Current Maintainer.
 5654: 
 5655:  5.  If the previously unreachable Current Maintainer becomes
 5656:      reachable once more within three months of a change completed
 5657:      under the terms of 3b) or 4), then that Current Maintainer must
 5658:      become or remain the Current Maintainer upon request provided
 5659:      they then update their communication data within one month.
 5660: 
 5661: A change in the Current Maintainer does not, of itself, alter the fact
 5662: that the Work is distributed under the LPPL license.
 5663: 
 5664: If you become the Current Maintainer of the Work, you should
 5665: immediately provide, within the Work, a prominent and unambiguous
 5666: statement of your status as Current Maintainer.  You should also
 5667: announce your new status to the same pertinent community as
 5668: in 2b) above.
 5669: 
 5670: 
 5671: WHETHER AND HOW TO DISTRIBUTE WORKS UNDER THIS LICENSE
 5672: ======================================================
 5673: 
 5674: This section contains important instructions, examples, and
 5675: recommendations for authors who are considering distributing their
 5676: works under this license.  These authors are addressed as `you' in
 5677: this section.
 5678: 
 5679: Choosing This License or Another License
 5680: ----------------------------------------
 5681: 
 5682: If for any part of your work you want or need to use *distribution*
 5683: conditions that differ significantly from those in this license, then
 5684: do not refer to this license anywhere in your work but, instead,
 5685: distribute your work under a different license.  You may use the text
 5686: of this license as a model for your own license, but your license
 5687: should not refer to the LPPL or otherwise give the impression that
 5688: your work is distributed under the LPPL.
 5689: 
 5690: The document `modguide.tex' in the base LaTeX distribution explains
 5691: the motivation behind the conditions of this license.  It explains,
 5692: for example, why distributing LaTeX under the GNU General Public
 5693: License (GPL) was considered inappropriate.  Even if your work is
 5694: unrelated to LaTeX, the discussion in `modguide.tex' may still be
 5695: relevant, and authors intending to distribute their works under any
 5696: license are encouraged to read it.
 5697: 
 5698: A Recommendation on Modification Without Distribution
 5699: -----------------------------------------------------
 5700: 
 5701: It is wise never to modify a component of the Work, even for your own
 5702: personal use, without also meeting the above conditions for
 5703: distributing the modified component.  While you might intend that such
 5704: modifications will never be distributed, often this will happen by
 5705: accident -- you may forget that you have modified that component; or
 5706: it may not occur to you when allowing others to access the modified
 5707: version that you are thus distributing it and violating the conditions
 5708: of this license in ways that could have legal implications and, worse,
 5709: cause problems for the community.  It is therefore usually in your
 5710: best interest to keep your copy of the Work identical with the public
 5711: one.  Many works provide ways to control the behavior of that work
 5712: without altering any of its licensed components.
 5713: 
 5714: How to Use This License
 5715: -----------------------
 5716: 
 5717: To use this license, place in each of the components of your work both
 5718: an explicit copyright notice including your name and the year the work
 5719: was authored and/or last substantially modified.  Include also a
 5720: statement that the distribution and/or modification of that
 5721: component is constrained by the conditions in this license.
 5722: 
 5723: Here is an example of such a notice and statement:
 5724: 
 5725:   %% pig.dtx
 5726:   %% Copyright 2005 M. Y. Name
 5727:   %
 5728:   % This work may be distributed and/or modified under the
 5729:   % conditions of the LaTeX Project Public License, either version 1.3
 5730:   % of this license or (at your option) any later version.
 5731:   % The latest version of this license is in
 5732:   %   http://www.latex-project.org/lppl.txt
 5733:   % and version 1.3 or later is part of all distributions of LaTeX
 5734:   % version 2005/12/01 or later.
 5735:   %
 5736:   % This work has the LPPL maintenance status `maintained'.
 5737:   %
 5738:   % The Current Maintainer of this work is M. Y. Name.
 5739:   %
 5740:   % This work consists of the files pig.dtx and pig.ins
 5741:   % and the derived file pig.sty.
 5742: 
 5743: Given such a notice and statement in a file, the conditions
 5744: given in this license document would apply, with the `Work' referring
 5745: to the three files `pig.dtx', `pig.ins', and `pig.sty' (the last being
 5746: generated from `pig.dtx' using `pig.ins'), the `Base Interpreter'
 5747: referring to any `LaTeX-Format', and both `Copyright Holder' and
 5748: `Current Maintainer' referring to the person `M. Y. Name'.
 5749: 
 5750: If you do not want the Maintenance section of LPPL to apply to your
 5751: Work, change `maintained' above into `author-maintained'.
 5752: However, we recommend that you use `maintained', as the Maintenance
 5753: section was added in order to ensure that your Work remains useful to
 5754: the community even when you can no longer maintain and support it
 5755: yourself.
 5756: 
 5757: Derived Works That Are Not Replacements
 5758: ---------------------------------------
 5759: 
 5760: Several clauses of the LPPL specify means to provide reliability and
 5761: stability for the user community. They therefore concern themselves
 5762: with the case that a Derived Work is intended to be used as a
 5763: (compatible or incompatible) replacement of the original Work. If
 5764: this is not the case (e.g., if a few lines of code are reused for a
 5765: completely different task), then clauses 6b and 6d shall not apply.
 5766: 
 5767: 
 5768: Important Recommendations
 5769: -------------------------
 5770: 
 5771:  Defining What Constitutes the Work
 5772: 
 5773:    The LPPL requires that distributions of the Work contain all the
 5774:    files of the Work.  It is therefore important that you provide a
 5775:    way for the licensee to determine which files constitute the Work.
 5776:    This could, for example, be achieved by explicitly listing all the
 5777:    files of the Work near the copyright notice of each file or by
 5778:    using a line such as:
 5779: 
 5780:     % This work consists of all files listed in manifest.txt.
 5781: 
 5782:    in that place.  In the absence of an unequivocal list it might be
 5783:    impossible for the licensee to determine what is considered by you
 5784:    to comprise the Work and, in such a case, the licensee would be
 5785:    entitled to make reasonable conjectures as to which files comprise
 5786:    the Work.
 5787: ''',
 5788:     ),
 5789:     (
 5790:         'MIT',
 5791:         '''\
 5792: MIT License
 5793: 
 5794: Copyright (c) [year] [fullname]
 5795: 
 5796: Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy
 5797: of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal
 5798: in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights
 5799: to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell
 5800: copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is
 5801: furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:
 5802: 
 5803: The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all
 5804: copies or substantial portions of the Software.
 5805: 
 5806: THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR
 5807: IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY,
 5808: FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE
 5809: AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER
 5810: LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM,
 5811: OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE
 5812: SOFTWARE.
 5813: ''',
 5814:     ),
 5815:     (
 5816:         'MPL-2.0',
 5817:         '''\
 5818: Mozilla Public License Version 2.0
 5819: ==================================
 5820: 
 5821: 1. Definitions
 5822: --------------
 5823: 
 5824: 1.1. "Contributor"
 5825:     means each individual or legal entity that creates, contributes to
 5826:     the creation of, or owns Covered Software.
 5827: 
 5828: 1.2. "Contributor Version"
 5829:     means the combination of the Contributions of others (if any) used
 5830:     by a Contributor and that particular Contributor's Contribution.
 5831: 
 5832: 1.3. "Contribution"
 5833:     means Covered Software of a particular Contributor.
 5834: 
 5835: 1.4. "Covered Software"
 5836:     means Source Code Form to which the initial Contributor has attached
 5837:     the notice in Exhibit A, the Executable Form of such Source Code
 5838:     Form, and Modifications of such Source Code Form, in each case
 5839:     including portions thereof.
 5840: 
 5841: 1.5. "Incompatible With Secondary Licenses"
 5842:     means
 5843: 
 5844:     (a) that the initial Contributor has attached the notice described
 5845:         in Exhibit B to the Covered Software; or
 5846: 
 5847:     (b) that the Covered Software was made available under the terms of
 5848:         version 1.1 or earlier of the License, but not also under the
 5849:         terms of a Secondary License.
 5850: 
 5851: 1.6. "Executable Form"
 5852:     means any form of the work other than Source Code Form.
 5853: 
 5854: 1.7. "Larger Work"
 5855:     means a work that combines Covered Software with other material, in
 5856:     a separate file or files, that is not Covered Software.
 5857: 
 5858: 1.8. "License"
 5859:     means this document.
 5860: 
 5861: 1.9. "Licensable"
 5862:     means having the right to grant, to the maximum extent possible,
 5863:     whether at the time of the initial grant or subsequently, any and
 5864:     all of the rights conveyed by this License.
 5865: 
 5866: 1.10. "Modifications"
 5867:     means any of the following:
 5868: 
 5869:     (a) any file in Source Code Form that results from an addition to,
 5870:         deletion from, or modification of the contents of Covered
 5871:         Software; or
 5872: 
 5873:     (b) any new file in Source Code Form that contains any Covered
 5874:         Software.
 5875: 
 5876: 1.11. "Patent Claims" of a Contributor
 5877:     means any patent claim(s), including without limitation, method,
 5878:     process, and apparatus claims, in any patent Licensable by such
 5879:     Contributor that would be infringed, but for the grant of the
 5880:     License, by the making, using, selling, offering for sale, having
 5881:     made, import, or transfer of either its Contributions or its
 5882:     Contributor Version.
 5883: 
 5884: 1.12. "Secondary License"
 5885:     means either the GNU General Public License, Version 2.0, the GNU
 5886:     Lesser General Public License, Version 2.1, the GNU Affero General
 5887:     Public License, Version 3.0, or any later versions of those
 5888:     licenses.
 5889: 
 5890: 1.13. "Source Code Form"
 5891:     means the form of the work preferred for making modifications.
 5892: 
 5893: 1.14. "You" (or "Your")
 5894:     means an individual or a legal entity exercising rights under this
 5895:     License. For legal entities, "You" includes any entity that
 5896:     controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with You. For
 5897:     purposes of this definition, "control" means (a) the power, direct
 5898:     or indirect, to cause the direction or management of such entity,
 5899:     whether by contract or otherwise, or (b) ownership of more than
 5900:     fifty percent (50%) of the outstanding shares or beneficial
 5901:     ownership of such entity.
 5902: 
 5903: 2. License Grants and Conditions
 5904: --------------------------------
 5905: 
 5906: 2.1. Grants
 5907: 
 5908: Each Contributor hereby grants You a world-wide, royalty-free,
 5909: non-exclusive license:
 5910: 
 5911: (a) under intellectual property rights (other than patent or trademark)
 5912:     Licensable by such Contributor to use, reproduce, make available,
 5913:     modify, display, perform, distribute, and otherwise exploit its
 5914:     Contributions, either on an unmodified basis, with Modifications, or
 5915:     as part of a Larger Work; and
 5916: 
 5917: (b) under Patent Claims of such Contributor to make, use, sell, offer
 5918:     for sale, have made, import, and otherwise transfer either its
 5919:     Contributions or its Contributor Version.
 5920: 
 5921: 2.2. Effective Date
 5922: 
 5923: The licenses granted in Section 2.1 with respect to any Contribution
 5924: become effective for each Contribution on the date the Contributor first
 5925: distributes such Contribution.
 5926: 
 5927: 2.3. Limitations on Grant Scope
 5928: 
 5929: The licenses granted in this Section 2 are the only rights granted under
 5930: this License. No additional rights or licenses will be implied from the
 5931: distribution or licensing of Covered Software under this License.
 5932: Notwithstanding Section 2.1(b) above, no patent license is granted by a
 5933: Contributor:
 5934: 
 5935: (a) for any code that a Contributor has removed from Covered Software;
 5936:     or
 5937: 
 5938: (b) for infringements caused by: (i) Your and any other third party's
 5939:     modifications of Covered Software, or (ii) the combination of its
 5940:     Contributions with other software (except as part of its Contributor
 5941:     Version); or
 5942: 
 5943: (c) under Patent Claims infringed by Covered Software in the absence of
 5944:     its Contributions.
 5945: 
 5946: This License does not grant any rights in the trademarks, service marks,
 5947: or logos of any Contributor (except as may be necessary to comply with
 5948: the notice requirements in Section 3.4).
 5949: 
 5950: 2.4. Subsequent Licenses
 5951: 
 5952: No Contributor makes additional grants as a result of Your choice to
 5953: distribute the Covered Software under a subsequent version of this
 5954: License (see Section 10.2) or under the terms of a Secondary License (if
 5955: permitted under the terms of Section 3.3).
 5956: 
 5957: 2.5. Representation
 5958: 
 5959: Each Contributor represents that the Contributor believes its
 5960: Contributions are its original creation(s) or it has sufficient rights
 5961: to grant the rights to its Contributions conveyed by this License.
 5962: 
 5963: 2.6. Fair Use
 5964: 
 5965: This License is not intended to limit any rights You have under
 5966: applicable copyright doctrines of fair use, fair dealing, or other
 5967: equivalents.
 5968: 
 5969: 2.7. Conditions
 5970: 
 5971: Sections 3.1, 3.2, 3.3, and 3.4 are conditions of the licenses granted
 5972: in Section 2.1.
 5973: 
 5974: 3. Responsibilities
 5975: -------------------
 5976: 
 5977: 3.1. Distribution of Source Form
 5978: 
 5979: All distribution of Covered Software in Source Code Form, including any
 5980: Modifications that You create or to which You contribute, must be under
 5981: the terms of this License. You must inform recipients that the Source
 5982: Code Form of the Covered Software is governed by the terms of this
 5983: License, and how they can obtain a copy of this License. You may not
 5984: attempt to alter or restrict the recipients' rights in the Source Code
 5985: Form.
 5986: 
 5987: 3.2. Distribution of Executable Form
 5988: 
 5989: If You distribute Covered Software in Executable Form then:
 5990: 
 5991: (a) such Covered Software must also be made available in Source Code
 5992:     Form, as described in Section 3.1, and You must inform recipients of
 5993:     the Executable Form how they can obtain a copy of such Source Code
 5994:     Form by reasonable means in a timely manner, at a charge no more
 5995:     than the cost of distribution to the recipient; and
 5996: 
 5997: (b) You may distribute such Executable Form under the terms of this
 5998:     License, or sublicense it under different terms, provided that the
 5999:     license for the Executable Form does not attempt to limit or alter
 6000:     the recipients' rights in the Source Code Form under this License.
 6001: 
 6002: 3.3. Distribution of a Larger Work
 6003: 
 6004: You may create and distribute a Larger Work under terms of Your choice,
 6005: provided that You also comply with the requirements of this License for
 6006: the Covered Software. If the Larger Work is a combination of Covered
 6007: Software with a work governed by one or more Secondary Licenses, and the
 6008: Covered Software is not Incompatible With Secondary Licenses, this
 6009: License permits You to additionally distribute such Covered Software
 6010: under the terms of such Secondary License(s), so that the recipient of
 6011: the Larger Work may, at their option, further distribute the Covered
 6012: Software under the terms of either this License or such Secondary
 6013: License(s).
 6014: 
 6015: 3.4. Notices
 6016: 
 6017: You may not remove or alter the substance of any license notices
 6018: (including copyright notices, patent notices, disclaimers of warranty,
 6019: or limitations of liability) contained within the Source Code Form of
 6020: the Covered Software, except that You may alter any license notices to
 6021: the extent required to remedy known factual inaccuracies.
 6022: 
 6023: 3.5. Application of Additional Terms
 6024: 
 6025: You may choose to offer, and to charge a fee for, warranty, support,
 6026: indemnity or liability obligations to one or more recipients of Covered
 6027: Software. However, You may do so only on Your own behalf, and not on
 6028: behalf of any Contributor. You must make it absolutely clear that any
 6029: such warranty, support, indemnity, or liability obligation is offered by
 6030: You alone, and You hereby agree to indemnify every Contributor for any
 6031: liability incurred by such Contributor as a result of warranty, support,
 6032: indemnity or liability terms You offer. You may include additional
 6033: disclaimers of warranty and limitations of liability specific to any
 6034: jurisdiction.
 6035: 
 6036: 4. Inability to Comply Due to Statute or Regulation
 6037: ---------------------------------------------------
 6038: 
 6039: If it is impossible for You to comply with any of the terms of this
 6040: License with respect to some or all of the Covered Software due to
 6041: statute, judicial order, or regulation then You must: (a) comply with
 6042: the terms of this License to the maximum extent possible; and (b)
 6043: describe the limitations and the code they affect. Such description must
 6044: be placed in a text file included with all distributions of the Covered
 6045: Software under this License. Except to the extent prohibited by statute
 6046: or regulation, such description must be sufficiently detailed for a
 6047: recipient of ordinary skill to be able to understand it.
 6048: 
 6049: 5. Termination
 6050: --------------
 6051: 
 6052: 5.1. The rights granted under this License will terminate automatically
 6053: if You fail to comply with any of its terms. However, if You become
 6054: compliant, then the rights granted under this License from a particular
 6055: Contributor are reinstated (a) provisionally, unless and until such
 6056: Contributor explicitly and finally terminates Your grants, and (b) on an
 6057: ongoing basis, if such Contributor fails to notify You of the
 6058: non-compliance by some reasonable means prior to 60 days after You have
 6059: come back into compliance. Moreover, Your grants from a particular
 6060: Contributor are reinstated on an ongoing basis if such Contributor
 6061: notifies You of the non-compliance by some reasonable means, this is the
 6062: first time You have received notice of non-compliance with this License
 6063: from such Contributor, and You become compliant prior to 30 days after
 6064: Your receipt of the notice.
 6065: 
 6066: 5.2. If You initiate litigation against any entity by asserting a patent
 6067: infringement claim (excluding declaratory judgment actions,
 6068: counter-claims, and cross-claims) alleging that a Contributor Version
 6069: directly or indirectly infringes any patent, then the rights granted to
 6070: You by any and all Contributors for the Covered Software under Section
 6071: 2.1 of this License shall terminate.
 6072: 
 6073: 5.3. In the event of termination under Sections 5.1 or 5.2 above, all
 6074: end user license agreements (excluding distributors and resellers) which
 6075: have been validly granted by You or Your distributors under this License
 6076: prior to termination shall survive termination.

 6126: jurisdiction, without reference to its conflict-of-law provisions.

 6128: cross-claims or counter-claims.

 6153: of the License under which You originally received the Covered Software,
 6154: or under the terms of any subsequent version published by the license
 6155: steward.

 6162: any references to the name of the license steward (except to note that
 6163: such modified license differs from this License).

 6349: -----------------------------------------------------------
 6350: 
 6351: PREAMBLE
 6352: The goals of the Open Font License (OFL) are to stimulate worldwide
 6353: development of collaborative font projects, to support the font creation
 6354: efforts of academic and linguistic communities, and to provide a free and
 6355: open framework in which fonts may be shared and improved in partnership
 6356: with others.
 6357: 
 6358: The OFL allows the licensed fonts to be used, studied, modified and
 6359: redistributed freely as long as they are not sold by themselves. The
 6360: fonts, including any derivative works, can be bundled, embedded,
 6361: redistributed and/or sold with any software provided that any reserved
 6362: names are not used by derivative works. The fonts and derivatives,
 6363: however, cannot be released under any other type of license. The
 6364: requirement for fonts to remain under this license does not apply
 6365: to any document created using the fonts or their derivatives.
 6366: 
 6367: DEFINITIONS
 6368: "Font Software" refers to the set of files released by the Copyright
 6369: Holder(s) under this license and clearly marked as such. This may
 6370: include source files, build scripts and documentation.
 6371: 
 6372: "Reserved Font Name" refers to any names specified as such after the
 6373: copyright statement(s).
 6374: 
 6375: "Original Version" refers to the collection of Font Software components as
 6376: distributed by the Copyright Holder(s).
 6377: 
 6378: "Modified Version" refers to any derivative made by adding to, deleting,
 6379: or substituting -- in part or in whole -- any of the components of the
 6380: Original Version, by changing formats or by porting the Font Software to a
 6381: new environment.
 6382: 
 6383: "Author" refers to any designer, engineer, programmer, technical
 6384: writer or other person who contributed to the Font Software.
 6385: 
 6386: PERMISSION AND CONDITIONS
 6387: Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining
 6388: a copy of the Font Software, to use, study, copy, merge, embed, modify,
 6389: redistribute, and sell modified and unmodified copies of the Font
 6390: Software, subject to the following conditions:
 6391: 
 6392: 1) Neither the Font Software nor any of its individual components,
 6393: in Original or Modified Versions, may be sold by itself.
 6394: 
 6395: 2) Original or Modified Versions of the Font Software may be bundled,
 6396: redistributed and/or sold with any software, provided that each copy
 6397: contains the above copyright notice and this license. These can be
 6398: included either as stand-alone text files, human-readable headers or
 6399: in the appropriate machine-readable metadata fields within text or
 6400: binary files as long as those fields can be easily viewed by the user.
 6401: 
 6402: 3) No Modified Version of the Font Software may use the Reserved Font
 6403: Name(s) unless explicit written permission is granted by the corresponding
 6404: Copyright Holder. This restriction only applies to the primary font name as
 6405: presented to the users.
 6406: 
 6407: 4) The name(s) of the Copyright Holder(s) or the Author(s) of the Font
 6408: Software shall not be used to promote, endorse or advertise any
 6409: Modified Version, except to acknowledge the contribution(s) of the
 6410: Copyright Holder(s) and the Author(s) or with their explicit written
 6411: permission.
 6412: 
 6413: 5) The Font Software, modified or unmodified, in part or in whole,
 6414: must be distributed entirely under this license, and must not be
 6415: distributed under any other license. The requirement for fonts to
 6416: remain under this license does not apply to any document created
 6417: using the Font Software.

 6420: This license becomes null and void if any of the above conditions are
 6421: not met.

 6443: Work:

 6445: Licensed under the Open Software License version 3.0
 6446: 
 6447: 1) Grant of Copyright License. Licensor grants You a worldwide, royalty-free,
 6448: non-exclusive, sublicensable license, for the duration of the copyright, to do
 6449: the following:
 6450: 
 6451:   a) to reproduce the Original Work in copies, either alone or as part of a
 6452:   collective work;
 6453: 
 6454:   b) to translate, adapt, alter, transform, modify, or arrange the Original
 6455:   Work, thereby creating derivative works ("Derivative Works") based upon the
 6456:   Original Work;
 6457: 
 6458:   c) to distribute or communicate copies of the Original Work and Derivative
 6459:   Works to the public, with the proviso that copies of Original Work or
 6460:   Derivative Works that You distribute or communicate shall be licensed under
 6461:   this Open Software License;
 6462: 
 6463:   d) to perform the Original Work publicly; and
 6464: 
 6465:   e) to display the Original Work publicly.
 6466: 
 6467: 2) Grant of Patent License. Licensor grants You a worldwide, royalty-free,
 6468: non-exclusive, sublicensable license, under patent claims owned or controlled
 6469: by the Licensor that are embodied in the Original Work as furnished by the
 6470: Licensor, for the duration of the patents, to make, use, sell, offer for sale,
 6471: have made, and import the Original Work and Derivative Works.
 6472: 
 6473: 3) Grant of Source Code License. The term "Source Code" means the preferred
 6474: form of the Original Work for making modifications to it and all available
 6475: documentation describing how to modify the Original Work. Licensor agrees to
 6476: provide a machine-readable copy of the Source Code of the Original Work along
 6477: with each copy of the Original Work that Licensor distributes. Licensor
 6478: reserves the right to satisfy this obligation by placing a machine-readable
 6479: copy of the Source Code in an information repository reasonably calculated to
 6480: permit inexpensive and convenient access by You for as long as Licensor
 6481: continues to distribute the Original Work.
 6482: 
 6483: 4) Exclusions From License Grant. Neither the names of Licensor, nor the names
 6484: of any contributors to the Original Work, nor any of their trademarks or
 6485: service marks, may be used to endorse or promote products derived from this
 6486: Original Work without express prior permission of the Licensor. Except as
 6487: expressly stated herein, nothing in this License grants any license to
 6488: Licensor's trademarks, copyrights, patents, trade secrets or any other

 6498: distribution, or communication of the Original Work or Derivative Works in any
 6499: way such that the Original Work or Derivative Works may be used by anyone

 6559: 11) Jurisdiction, Venue and Governing Law. Any action or suit relating to this
